Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I believe SYNCHRONY BANK violated 15 usc 1691 ( d ) ( 6 ) For purposes of this subsection, the term adverse action means a denial or revocation of credit, a change in the terms of an existing credit arrangement, or a refusal to grant credit in substantially the amount or on substantially the terms requested. Such term does not include a refusal to extend additional credit under an existing credit arrangement where the applicant is delinquent or otherwise in default, or where such additional credit would exceed a previously established credit limit. In my case SYNCHRONY BANK revoked my credit. Shown in exhibits.

I believe SYNCHRONY BANK is civilly liable for their action 15 USC 1691e ( b ) Any creditor, other than a government or governmental subdivision or agency, who fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter shall be liable to the aggrieved applicant for punitive damages in an amount not greater than {$10000.00}, in addition to any actual damages provided in subsection ( a ), except that in the case of a class action the total recovery under this subsection shall not exceed the lesser of {$500000.00} or 1 per centum of the net worth of the creditor. In determining the amount of such damages in any action, the court shall consider, among other relevant factors, the amount of any actual damages awarded, the frequency and persistence of failures of compliance by the creditor, the resources of the creditor, the number of persons adversely affected, and the extent to which the creditors failure of compliance was intentional. Shown in exhibits.

Fact, SYNCHRONY BANK did not get authorization from me the original creditor pursuant to 15 usc 1602 ( g ) to close my account and take my credit away pursuant to 15 usc 1602 ( f ). I believe the credit grantor/debtor does not have the same authority as the original creditor. Shown in exhibits.

Fact, SYNCHRONY BANK violated 15 usc 1602 ( p ) unauthorized use of my credit card which is my social security card 15 usc 1602 ( l ) because I did not benefit from the consumer credit transaction that I authorized on XX/XX/XXXX. I believe SYNCHRONY BANK is criminally liable for their actions pursuant to 15 usc 1611 ( 1 ) willful and knowing the original creditor did not give authorization to close account. Shown in exhibits.

This is my second affidavit of truth being served to Synchrony Bank my first affidavit has been ignored. File uploaded will include my first and second affidavit.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was shocked when I reviewed my credit report this week and I found multiple inaccuracies on my credit report from the 3 major credit bureaus from a collection company that I never have dealt with before. I've attempted several times to ratify the issue with the original creditors and credit bureaus and they still reporting inaccurate, unverifiable information. I have disputed this item with the credit reporting agency and they reported you confirmed the account as valid. I honestly do not believe to ever have any relationship with this collection agency or original creditor. Also there are several inaccuracies with this account the way it's reporting and that's a total violation of FCRA and FDCPA laws and regulations. In a good faith effort to resolve the matter amicably, I must demand proof of this debt, specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature, as well as proof of your authority in this matter. Absent such proof, you must correct any erroneous reports of this past debt as mine. I am writing to request that you please provide the following information : 1. Please evidence your authorization under 15 USC 1692 ( e ) and 15 USC 1692 ( f ) in this alleged matter. 2. What is your authorization of law for your collection of information? 3. What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt? 4. Please evidence your authorization to do business or operate in this state. 5. Please evidence proof of the alleged debt, including the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. 6. Please provide a complete account history, including any charges added for collection activity. 
You have 30 days upon receipt of this letter to provide strict proof of contract. In the event you can not provide strict proof of contract, you must cease and desist any and all collection efforts and immediately remove any derogatory information reported to the consumer reporting agencies. In addition, you will need to provide me your agreement, in writing, that you are closing your file, ceasing collecting activity, and deleting all information related to this reference number from any and all credit reports youve furnished the information to. In the event you transfer this account to an attorney without providing proof of contract, and proving your claim, he/she will be immediate reported to the XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX for code of ethics violations.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call at my work, from XXXX XXXX saying she had to speak with me right away. I tried calling her back on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with a XXXX XXXX who wanted my date of birth and social security number yet refused to disclose who he was and why he was contacting me. On their recorded line, I told him I am not to be called at work, I dont know why they are calling and It sounded like a scam so I ended the call. 
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX calls me at work again and leaves a message. After work, I call her back to have a bantering conversation with her and she told me the last 4 digits on my social security number, by saying the first and third number were the same, I said yes and she then identified herself as a debt collector for Ascension student loans for my non payment of over {$200000.00} in student loan debt. I told her this was a case from XXXX of identity theft and the first part of my SSN is NOT matching their records, the other persons birthday is in XXXX and the debt is not line and to never contact me again. She said she can contact me. I told her I dealt with this claim with the CFPB and she started getting nervous. She is with Delta Management Associates, Incorporated. XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2020 I XXXX XXXX made a phone call to XXXX XXXX XXXX to take care of a debt that I incurred from XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$850.00}. At the time of speaking with the debt collector they set me up with two seperate payments which was requested by me. On XX/XX/2020 I made a payment of {$420.00} and then of XX/XX/2020 I made the second payment via an auto draft from my bank account of {$420.00}. On XX/XX/2020 when I made the first payment I asked teh debt collector reprsentative that was taking my payment that once I made the final payment would there be something sent to the creditors on my behalf to remove or delete as that was what I requested and they said yes once the final payment had been recieved. They also informed me that they will automatically mail me out a letter stating that it had been paid in full. Once I made the final payment on XXXX XXXX and I did not recieve anything in mail after a week I called the debt collector and asked them why I had not recieved anything in mail and thats when they told me that I had toc all and request that. I explained that the last representative that I spoke with did not tell me that I needed to call in however, she stated that it was something that they automatically did. To my surprise I did not get accurate information. Also, to have it removed or deleted the representative told me that it was something that was available upon request which I did request However, only to find out that this has not been removed or deleted from my credit. The last report showed that it was indeed paid in full but also as an active account which is not the truth. According to my research this is a UDAAP violation when there is Diceptive Acts of Practice which was very misleading for me and an very unnessary process to do the things that I need to do.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Despite several written requests, the unverified bankruptcies listed on my report still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a COPY of the ORIGINAL documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. Your company have not sent me any documentation that verify the information they are reporting. In the results of your first investigation and subsequent reinvestigation, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? Your company have said the courthouse verified the public record which is a lie, I contacted the bankruptcy court and I sent a letter directly from the courthouse stating they do not verify with 3rd parties. Which I have attached to this complaint. It is also illegal to report inaccurate information on my report that has not been accurate verified. You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ). Your company have failed to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX I C SYSTEM XXXX I.C. SYSTEM, INC XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity. 
A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious I C SYSTEM XXXX I.C. SYSTEM, INC XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
So today, I pulled my consumer credit reports with XXXX and TransUnion and I immediately noticed a host of FCRA violations in regards to the DEPT OF ED/XXXX accounts being reported without my permission. Lets take a look at section 15 U.S. Code 1681 and see

what Congress has to say about this section : ( a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting The Congress makes the following findings

: ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

( 2 ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers.

( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers.

( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. Now lets look at another section of the FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681b and see whats being said in that section : ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, or a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury. 
( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. As a Consumer, a couple things stood out. First I never provided written instructions as is required under 15 U.S. Code 1681b to any Consumer Reporting Agency to furnish my reports, and by doing so without that permissible purpose, you have damaged my reputation and infringed upon my right to privacy as a federally protected Consumer.

Furthermore, they confirmed that they did receive my payment for the annual fee back in XXXX but failed to update my account with the new balance ( which was {$0.00} ) which resulted in them reporting me to the credit bureau. To explain, XXXX XXXX continued to charge me for the annual fee even though I had already paid them the fee. Every month from XXXX to XXXX they reported a missed payment to all three credit bureaus. They apologized for their mistake and ensure me that they will contact the credit bureau to remove all the negative marks they put on my account as this was their negligence for not verifying their information about my account. It is now XX/XX/XXXX ( I spoke to them XXXX XXXX ) and the missed payment has not been removed. I also open a dispute with Experian and Experian said they refuse to remove it. It seems like the only thing left to do is to take them to court because they are violating the federal fair credit reporting act ( FCRA ) and has damaged my creditworthiness.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Back on XX/XX/2020 I went back to work after being furloughed due to covid. My hours were cut from 40 hours a week to 30 hours a week. This was due to covid and the pandemic.

My car company was aware of my hardship and had even notated my account as affected by covid. My fianc is in the entertainment industry. Hes been out of work and waiting on unemployment due to covid. So basically Ive been supporting a family of 5 by myself. I had advised Flagship and they were aware of the situation. In late XXXX I made a full payment. 
Theyd offered me an extension. When I called back in XXXX to verify it still hadnt been approved. So they advised they were requesting two extensions due to loss of hours and theyd place on end of loan. They never said anything about it hurting my credit. Instead they said to call back and verify if it was approved or not. So I kept calling and finally it was approved in XXXX. As long as I made a full payment. Please see attachments. 

Then came my credit. XXXX XXXX, 30 days past due. I disputed then it changed to XXXX. I disputed and now its changed to XXXX. I spoke with a Supervisor she advised it would be fixed. I wrote a letter only for them to write back saying its valid. 

In good faith I made an agreement based on my loss of hours because of covid. Now my credit has been adversely effected. They even took the comment off my account stating that Ive been effected by covid.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I contacted XXXX to correct a negative payment history on a credit card with Wells Fargo from XX/XX/XXXX. I provided the following information. 

In XX/XX/XXXX I was XXXX when all communication was secured for operational security. We were without internet access for approximately 40 days. During this time, the credit card payment was due, but I was unable to make the payment without internet access. As soon as access was restored, I promptly paid the bill in its entirety. 

XXXX  closed the investigation today. They added the addition to the comment section : " and dispute investigation completed, consumer disagrees. '' The comment could be construed that an investigation was actually conducted, which seems doubtful, and I disagreed with the results of the investigation. To my knowledge I have not been provided with any further information collected during the investigation such as a response from Wells Fargo. Dispute and disagree are synonymous, so not only could the comment be misconstrued, but it would seem that the entirety of the investigation was to add a comment documenting that I disagreed or disputed something, which required no investigation at all because the " investigation '' was a direct consequence of filing a dispute with the report. 

If XXXX or Wells Fargo had provided documentation or rational to the justification for the negative mark on my credit score, I would have been receptive to concluding this matter ; however, this resolution was recursive and evidences the insincere at best or false claim that XXXX actually investigated the matter. If an investigation did not take place, they have willfully neglected their responsibility to investigate this dispute.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Whom It May concern : I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge on my account in the amount of {$1800.00}. 
I am a victim of Identity theft, and I did not make or authorize this charge. I am requesting that the charge be removed, that any finance other charges related to the fraudulent amount be credited, as well and that I receive an accurate statement. This request is made pursuant to the Fair Credit Billing Acts amendments to the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. 1666-1666b, 12 C.F.R 226.13. See Also 12 C.F.R 226.12 ( b ) I am writing to request the method of verification for dispute initiated on XX/XX/XXXX and the subsequent response received on XX/XX/XXXX enclosed with this letter. 
In accordance with FCRA, Section 611, I am requesting this information to review for completeness and accuracy and appropriateness. In lieu of sending the information you can reopen the dispute and ensure a proper investigation is performed. 
I would appreciate a timely response outlining the steps that will occur to resolve this matter. If I do not receive a response I will have no choice but to exercise my right under FRCA, Section 616, and pursue legal action. 

-- CLOSED ACCOUNT 1. XXXX XXXX  XXXX with ACCT # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$1800.00} -This is not my account.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
Ally Auto Fiancial ( Auto Loan ) This is my second vehicle financed by Ally Auto. The previous vehicle was a XXXX XXXX, which I paid off before time in full ; hence Im a good customer. 
Due to the COVID-19 furlough, I had requested more time to pay my current Ally auto payments. I was asked to contact via chat, and I did on XX/XX/XXXX. I was assured that I would not be paying any interest etc., till the end of XX/XX/XXXX. 
However, I received an email from Ally in early XX/XX/XXXX that I was late in payment. Then, on XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Ally auto via email and phone. Email reply was an auto-reply from Ally asking me to call. I have tried several times to call Ally auto but was promptly placed on hold for more than 45 minutes. I was told by one representative on phone you are from XXXX, why are you in the USA. ( Im a proud US Citizen ) I called a few more times to work something out with Ally auto, but every time was placed on hold, endlessly. 
Ally auto never called me back or replied to my emails to work out a payment plan or a fair resolution. I believe I have been treated unfairly inspite of having an excellent paying history. 
Ally Financial is also unfairly sending a negative report to credit bureaus. 
I am requesting that Ally Auto cancel my payments for a couple of months and retract any negative report sent and work out a payment plan. 
Im hoping that this can be resolved in a mutually agreeable term. Ally financial called today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and threatened to repossess the car and ruin my credit history. I believe I am a victim of Ally Auto 's predatory business practices, discrimination and bias. 
I'm being forced to pay inspite of promises made by Ally Financial without making any current concessions due to COVID-19 pandemic. 
Thank You for your help! 
XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was never contacted by this company ( IQ Data ) via phone or mail. They had the wrong name and address but left a message with my mother. I returned the call as a willing payer. Both representatives I spoke with were rude, offensive, yelling, and abusive. 
I explained to them that this debt was in regard to a move out balance and because the apartment complex sold the business to another company I could not get my move out balance because they never returned my calls and when I contacted them via email I was told that the company had sold and that I would be contacted. 
When I spoke with the debt collection agency I explained this was not a broken lease or eviction and my arrangement is in writing and still stands. I also told them I never received any letters because they were sending the statements to the addressed the debt belonged to which I obviously no longer lived. I was told by them I had no reason for a dispute and I have to pay the balance in full today or it would be reported to my credit bureau. I tried to give my current address which has also been updated with the USPS, he refused to send me a statement of the charges. He said I did not update my info with the USPS and that was my problem. I was yelled at over and over by agents and as a collections professional myself I am appalled at how they conduct business XXXX ( second agent with IQ Data ) also refused to take my phone number and stated the only thing he would accept from me is a Visa, Mastercard, or Discover. The balance is now {$1700.00} and he refused to give me a breakdown of the charges. I have every intention on paying what I truly owe this company and only reached out to them because I have not received a notice or bill nor did was I made aware of my rights or options.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I requested for Experian to remove the bankruptcy from my credit report because the information they received is incorrect and was not received directly through the bankruptcy court. In the State of New Jersey, the bankruptcy court DOES NOT report to the credit bureaus at all, therefore making this record unverifiable. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

I notified them that wasnt the case and asked them to produce something in writing showing that I asked for a second account. They were unable to do so. In XX/XX/XXXX I filed a formal challenge with Experian ( please see attached ). Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, states that [ Experian ] is required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. They have not and can not provide any written proof that I have ever applied for this second account. As a result, my financial reputation is at risk. Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I own a vacation rental property and a man named XXXX XXXX reached out to to me through XXXX and wanted to rent my vacation home. He said his company was paying so he needed to send a check. When I received the check ( from XXXX XXXX, XXXX in XXXX, TN on a Bank of America check ) it was for more than he owed and he asked me to XXXX the difference once the check clears. I electronic deposited it to my checking account at Bank of America, it showed cleared later that day and I sent the difference of {$2200.00} via XXXX to XXXX XXXX at email XXXX, which was also a Bank of America account. A few days later, XXXX said he had to cancel the reservation because his wife got XXXX and asked if I could refund the rest. I sent the remaining {$2200.00} to XXXX XXXX via XXXX at email XXXX which was a XXXX account I think. Several days later, I got a letter in the mail from my bank, Bank of America, notifying me that the original check was fraudulent. I immediately called Bank of America to notify them of entirety of the fraud however, the funds could not be recovered from the XXXX accounts as the accounts had been closed. I feel like Bank of America had multiple opportunities to protect me during this and failed to do so. They should not have allowed me to initially deposit a fraudulent check, it, especially because this was a Bank of America check. Once they were unable to retrieve the funds from the check, they should have notified me in a more timely and urgent manner ( i.e. a phone call, email text message ) than through the mail, which would have prevented me from dispersing those funds through XXXX. Furthermore, one of the accounts that I send the fraudulent funds to was another Bank of America account which gave Bank of America ample opportunity to recognize the fraud/crime and intervene to protect me. I recently met with two agents from the Department of Homeland Security because XXXX XXXX was involved with another fraud case they were investigating and they said that Bank of America should have done more to protect me and should reimburse me the {$3900.00} I have lost.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been unable to get into my Experian account for several months. This is critically important because I need to add a security freeze after someone fraudulently filed an unemployment comp claim using credentials exposed in a data breach.

I no longer have the password to my Experian account, but I can't recover it because Experian insists on sending a text code to the now disconnected land line. No alternatives for trying to recover the password online work. 

I've tried numerous times to get a way to recover the account, including calling them. The phone lines branch to directions to make the change on the website which, of course, only works if you can actually log in - which I can't.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Whom It May concern : I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge on my account in the amount of {$2600.00}, {$23000.00}.

I am a victim of Identity theft, and I did not make or authorize this charge. I am requesting that the charge be removed, that any finance other charges related to the fraudulent amount be credited, as well and that I receive an accurate statement. This request is made pursuant to the Fair Credit Billing Acts amendments to the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. 1666-1666b, 12 C.F.R 226.13. See Also 12 C.F.R 226.12 ( b ) I am writing to request the method of verification for dispute initiated on XX/XX/XXXX and the subsequent response received on XX/XX/XXXX enclosed with this letter. 
In accordance with FCRA, Section 611, I am requesting this information to review for completeness and accuracy and appropriateness. In lieu of sending the information you can reopen the dispute and ensure a proper investigation is performed.

I would appreciate a timely response outlining the steps that will occur to resolve this matter. If I do not receive a response I will have no choice but to exercise my right under FRCA, Section 616, and pursue legal action.

-- OPEN ACCOUNT 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX  with ACCT # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$2600.00} -This is not my account. 

-- PERSONAL ACCOUNT 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with ACCT # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$23000.00} -This is not my account.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I've recently reach out to XXXX Chief Financial Officer on XX/XX/2021 for the 3rd time about verifications of account number XXXX thats reporting on my credit reports. I provided my social security number and account number but the C.F.O stated he was unable to find or verify that account. He requested additional information that I can not produce because the account do not belong to me. If the C.F.O of the company can not verify this account, How are you verifying this account? Please send me your verification method and original signed contract in 10 days.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for credit bureaus reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 
Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the account.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is regarding a charge-back dispute dated XX/XX/XXXX. The dispute is over the purchase of plane tickets valued at XXXX dollars dated XX/XX/XXXX. The dispute record number for this claim with my creditor is XXXX. 

I have included in this complaint : a record of my first email exchange with XXXX customer service, my second email exchange with XXXX customer service. My email exchange with the U. S. Department of Transportation, my second claim letter to my creditor, and the U.S. Department of Transportations original mandate that justifies my claim to a full refund. 

As I argued in my original claim, XXXX canceled my flight due to COVID-19 complications. They initially tried to offer a voucher as a form of reimbursement. After I replied that I was due a full refund and that this refund is mandatory per the Department of Transportations enforcement notice, they requested my account information to transfer my refund. They then promptly cut off all communication with me and did not reply to my emails. 

After originally opening my dispute, both XXXX and my creditor argued that the refund terms were fulfilled and that I was not owed a refund. They claimed that the merchant has a no refund cancelation policy therefore I am not owed anything. This completely ignores the DOT enforcement that I included in my dispute claim. XXXX has also failed to respond to my DOT complaint within the required window of time, indicating they have no intention of interacting with me in good faith as a merchant. Furthermore, my creditor is obligated to credit this amount as it is considered a billing error under USC Title 15, Chapter 41, Subchapter 1 Part D Section 1666 ( b ) ( 3 ). XXXX has announced bankruptcy on XXXX XXXX, XXXX and cancelled their flights for the year XXXX ; they are unable to fulfill their obligations. I made this argument to my creditor, but they have not provided any counter argument to my claim and have simply rejected my dispute a second time with no justifiable grounds beyond the simply cancelation policy that XXXX originally provided.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2021 I was applying for credit and needed to lift security freezes that I have in place with the three credit reporting bureaus. 

In several minutes and with the few clicks of the mouse, I was able to successfully lift freezes at XXXX  and XXXX. However, I was not able to do so with Experian. 

After submitting my information along with a unique PIN identifier, I received notification that Experian is " unable to honor my request based on the information provided '' and that I needed to submit in writing via mail a copy of this notification from Experian along with additional paper copies of a government ID, utility bill, and Social Security card. 

This is a difficult request to fulfill in the era of COVID as I, like many, do not have easy access to a printer. Furthermore, Experian did not provide an email address through which I could submit copies of the required information. One can apply for credit from a bank completely electronically ; however the same can not be said about unfreezing your credit with Experian. 

Moreover, Experian 's customer service hotline pushes users to automated prompts and does not give one the option the speak with an actual human being about this problem.

I would like Experian to have an easy way to interact with actual people on their customer service hotline ( as opposed to automated prompts ) to talk to someone about unfreezing my credit by means other than paper mail during a time when many people simply do not or can not easily get access to paper documents. 

Thank you.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX CONVERGENT OUTSOURCING XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report. 
I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft. 
( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity. 
A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious CONVERGENT OUTSOURCING XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re Portfolio Recovery Associates, LLC Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: I signed a year lease with my girlfriend in XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. Once we reached the end of the lease, I decided to move. She decided to stay in the home and signed a renewal directly with the property company. I never signed the document as I moved out ; however, the property management company allowed her to live there and sign just her name. She later broke the lease and XXXX XXXX now known as XXXX XXXX XXXX sent it to a collections agency and placed a negative mark on my credit requesting {$4500.00}. I've disputed this with XXXX  in XX/XX/XXXX, the collections agency ( Southwest Recovery ) in XX/XX/XXXX, and now recently directly with the property management company XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This was clearly a bad business practice that their account manager, XXXX XXXX admits. She said the policy was changed as a result of many of these types of mishaps and they now require both signatures. According to Sec 94.053 both tenant and landlord must sign the lease and in Sec 94.055 it states if you they don't receive any communication from the tenant, then the renewal could be modified if the tenant remains on the property. Their renewal even states that the renewal must be signed by the tenant. If I was the tenant, then why was I not required to sign it? The Texas Property code doesnt say the property management has the right to renew a lease without the signature of the tenant but it does allow you to modify the renewal ( change rent, etc. )

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of 2017, I opened a checking account with XXXX XXXX XXXX. In XXXX of 2017, I deposited a check into the account that ended up being drawn on an account that had just been closed, although I did not know it. My account was immediately frozen. I called customer service, and they told me what had happened and suggested that I go speak to the manager of the bank branch where I had opened the account, who should be able to lift the freeze. 

When I went to the bank to see the manager, I was accompanied by my two granddaughters, who are XXXX. The manager stared at them, and it was obvious to me that because he was white, he was making a XXXX judgment on me ( I'm also white ) for having XXXX grandchildren. He was very rude to me and told me that because the deposit I made was returned, it caused several checks I had written to bounce. Although the account was not overdrawn, because I had bounced a check in the first 30 days, he said that bank had to close my account. The manager returned to me the money that was still in the account, and closed it during my visit. He assured me that there would be no negative reporting ramifications from the closure, as it was not my fault. 

Recently, I attempted to open an account with a different bank and was denied. I obtained a copy of my ChexSystems Report ( as recommended by the denying bank ) to see why I had been denied, and I noted that XXXX  XXXX XXXX had reported me to ChexSystems in 2017, indicating they had closed my account due to " suspected fraud ''. This is completely inaccurate. The ChexSystems report also indicated that I had an unpaid amount owed to XXXX as a result of the closed account, which is also inaccurate. 

I contacted XXXX several times to request that they remove the false information from ChexSystems, but the customer service reps I spoke with said they were unable to do so, but could not provide me any valid reason why ( as they agreed with me as to why my account had been closed and confirmed I did not owe XXXX any money ). 

The false and negative report by XXXX  XXXX XXXX to ChexSystems is preventing me from opening any bank accounts, which I need to do for my small business. I am being harmed severely every day that the false information remains on the report.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing bankruptcies that EXPERIAN has been reporting on my consumer credit report since XX/XX/2020. I have sent them multiple letters disputing the alleged bankruptcies explaining why the item that they are reporting must be deleted from my consumer credit report. Each time they send me correspondence stating the item was verified-certified. No information on how the information was certified or verified. However, after reviewing my Experian Credit report, I discovered that Experian used a third-party data company. On XX/XX/2020, I sent Experian another certified dispute letter with supporting documentation. I received another letter from Experian stating that after their investigation, that it is verified-certified the item belongs to me. I have submitted a CFPB complaint on this item as well as others. In every letter, I have sent to them I have included a copy of my state driver 's license and a copy of my social security card. After receiving the response from Experian in regard, I sent another letter requesting the items be deleted and enclosed a copy of my social security card, ID with my name and correct address as proof of my identity. I received correspondence from Experian stating that once again the disputed item was verified-certified. I am convinced at this time, that either they are not conducting their investigation under the laws and guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or they are blowing me off. Whichever it may be they are violating my rights under the laws of the FCRA and are knowingly reporting inaccurate information and participating in unethical reporting practices.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX CREDIT COLLECTION SERV XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report.

I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ). 
( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity.

A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information. 
The reference items are listed below please take this matter very serious CREDIT COLLECTION SERV XXXX I have report your company to consumerfinance.gov As a form of record and I am prepare to sue your company Example In re Portfolio Recovery Associates, LLC Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation, Case No. XXXX, in the U.S. District Court for the XXXX District of California Stop collection proceedings against me Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report XXXX, XXXX SOC SEC # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020, I purchased a XXXX product from XXXX and then the funds were not added to the prepaid product. I paid XXXX for this transaction. The next day on XX/XX/2020 I called XXXX at XXXX and was told they would send a check for the balance on the card since that balance was not loaded. However at this time they were having " technical issues '' and was denied a refund of XXXX. I then called again at XXXX XXXX EST on XX/XX/2020 and spoke to XXXX - who told me I should seek that refund from XXXX and that is what the system is showing. XXXX refused me a refund in the morning since they were specifically told by XXXX that XXXX would provide the refund. I am out XXXX with no recourse at this time. Both XXXX and XXXX are denying a refund for a card I purchased. I was with XXXX on the phone as I filled this complaint. After further research the card is showing " refunded to store '' at XXXX at XXXX XXXX on the same day of purchase on XX/XX/2020. I DID NOT do this - this was clearly fraud. They stated that XXXX had my money. 

I attempted to file the complaint via the Barclays bank dispute process. Barclays stated they reviewed the letter but a letter from the US Federal Reserve was inadequate to reverse a decision in this matter. I spoke to a manager at Barclays named XXXX, who stated that since this was a face to face transaction there was nothing they could - again despite a letter from US Fed ; I am having trouble understanding what gives Barclays the right to ignore the Federal Reserve. 

In the Federal Reserve Complaint it is stated, " XXXX XXXX concluded its investigation and determined that the gift card balance had already been refunded to XXXX Store # XXXX on XX/XX/2020. We confirmed that the funds have been reversed back to XXXX Store # XXXX, and that you will need to contact the store for resolution. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
More than once I asked Experian to verify to me how they obtained the Bankruptcy information on my Credit Report when I asked them for their Method of Verification. Instead, Experian indicated to me that the Outcome Remains, by stating to me that the company that reported the information has certified to Experian that the information is accurate. Experian was able to tell me that the company certified the Bankruptcy as accurate on my Credit Report, but they also certified that they do not really know what company gave them the information by their Wording! Experian said that they MAY have obtained the Bankruptcy information through a third-party vendor, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
How can this Bankruptcy information be certified as accurate when you do not know where you actually obtained it from? When you say MAY HAVE, that indicates uncertainty, also Experian said that the information came from the Courts, I asked the Courts in a letter if they give out Bankruptcy information to third-parties, such as Credit Bureaus, XXXX etc. and the U.S. Bankruptcy Court sent me a letter back stating that they DO NOT PROVIDE INFORMATION TO ANY CREDIT REPORTING ANGENCY. All documentation has been uploaded and attached to this complaint for proof and verifying. 
The FCRA under Federal and State Law states, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of the furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The FCRA requires the Credit Reporting Agencies to follow reasonable procedure to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report to a consumers Credit Report. Since Experian do not know where they obtained the Bankruptcy information and the Courts have confirmed that they do not provide Bankruptcy information to any third parties, such as Credit Reporting Agencies, this Bankruptcy is inaccurate and unverifiable and must be deleted!

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo is inaccurately and unfairly reporting to credit bureaus and causing further debt entrapment to their customers. 

During the lockdown, I requested my loans be entered into a forbearance XXXX and I entered again from XXXX. WF did not communicate limits to this and subsequently removed them from this status resulting in 30-60-90 day late reporting. Again, no limits had been communicated to me or my co-signer, despite me making an additional request in XXXX to extend. 

When I inquired when/why these changes places to place, it took speaking to the XXXX to get an answer that wasn't " you need to pay these to bring them current ... that's all we know '' and I waited an additional 15 days to be told they had no intention of acknowledging their lack of compassion, communication, or damage to my credit report. In addition to catching them rack fees in my account and being issued a refund for multiple instances of these fee assessments, I believe Wells Fargo is a predatory bank that should be investigated. 

They are resolving themselves of their place in the student debt crisis and selling their student loan accounts to a third party -- leaving thousands of us with loans nearly in default to instead deal with collection agencies where additional fees will be added. 

This is unfair, inaccurate, and it should be examined further to prevent Wells Fargo from further profiting from it's predation.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am furious. My credit card numbers were stolen and 58 fraudulent charges were made on my account ( {$3300.00} in total ). I promptly advised Citi of the theft. I spent over an hour on the phone going over the false charges and was assured they would cancel/reverse the fraudulent charges. A replacement card was sent out and Citi immediately cancelled the card. 

A week later Citi had a person call me who spoke absolutely no English. I tried to go over the charges/fraud again. He did not understand a thing I was saying. Despite my repeated requests, he refused to transfer me to someone who spoke English. Finally, I told him to have a supervisor who speaks English call me or send me in writing any further requests for information that they needed. He hung up. 

When no one contacted me by phone or letter or asked for any supporting documentation in the next 3 weeks, concerned, I checked online. Citibank had failed to put in dispute a single one of the charges I had spoken to two fraud specialists about ( and had cancelled my card because of ). 

I then spent an entire day submitting my dispute online on XX/XX/2021. I told Citi in the disputes online that I was mailing all of the supporting documentation to show fraud. Instead of doing any investigation, 3 days after I submitted the dispute and before they could have even received my documentation, they falsely stated that I had failed to respond to their ( non-existent ) request for information. 

I have copies of everything. This is where I sent the documentation : Fraud Investigations/ Dispute Resolution Citibank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX KY XXXX I provided them with a complete list of all fraudulent charges, all of which were easily traceable to other people ( train tickets even had names on them and all the furniture and XXXX charges had to be delivered somewhere ). I also attached the official XXXX XXXX of all of my account charges for the relevant time period so that they could see valid charges vs fraudulent, e.g. not charges made from my account. I provided a sworn attestation and agreed to fully cooperate in their investigation. 

It is unbelievable that they did no investigation at all. I will be closing all of my accounts with them and switching to a different bank card. This company 's willful disregard of teh law or gross incompetence is outrageous. I have never had this problem with XXXX or XXXX.

Product: Checking or savings account

THIS IS AN ADDENDUM/CORRECTION TO MY COMPLAINT # XXXX WHICH INDICATED THE WRONG SAVING ACCOUNT #. THE CORRECTED ACCOUNT NUMBER IS REFERENCED IN STEP # 4. 
IN ADDITION, XXXX POLICE REPORT/COMPLAINT # : XXXX was filed XX/XX/21. 
Citibank , N.A . failed to safeguard my funds in my Savings Plus account. My account was hacked on XX/XX/21 ( probably on XX/XX/21 ) as I was able to see the unauthorized ACH debit posted to an unknown account/person ( XXXX ) in the amount of {$19000.00}. 
I was shocked and immediately tried to report the fraud to Citibank and was sent to XXXX representative XXXX ID # : XXXX and explained what I saw and asked to report this as fraud/hacking. After several transfers and was unable to hear clearly I asked for a US representative in the Fraud department. I was told these funds were completely gone and the ACH transferred without any red flag alert, security check or confirmation that this large transfer was never my habit in 39 years of banking with Citibank. They did not transfer money in increments, but in less than overnight-they fully completed this fraudulent transaction. I was asked if I wanted to dispute and then assigned CASE ID # : XXXX. 
It has been my clear pattern and habit to transfer any funds from savings into checking before executing an ACH Debit. They said all that was needed to execute this fraud was my name, routing number and account number. This was very alarming, but they did not seem to want to expedite this matter until I asked to speak to a supervisor. Supervisor XXXX ID # : XXXX then expedited this to Citibank 's PECS Department which is internal, back office and I am not able to contact them directly. I have still not been given provisional credit or return of my funds and they only will say their investigation is " ongoing '' while I can not use my funds which I need now very much.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing bankruptcies that XXXX  has been reporting on my consumer credit report since XX/XX/2020. I have sent them multiple letters disputing the alleged bankruptcies explaining why the item that they are reporting must be deleted from my consumer credit report. Each time they send me correspondence stating the item was verified-certified. No information on how the information was certified or verified. However, after reviewing my XXXX  Credit report, I discovered that XXXX used a third-party data company. On XX/XX/2020, I sent XXXX  another certified dispute letter with supporting documentation. I received another letter from XXXX  stating that after their investigation, that it is verified-certified the item belongs to me. I have submitted a CFPB complaint on this item as well as others. In every letter, I have sent to them I have included a copy of my state driver 's license and a copy of my social security card. After receiving the response from XXXX  in regard, I sent another letter requesting the items be deleted and enclosed a copy of my social security card, ID with my name and correct address as proof of my identity. I received correspondence from XXXX  stating that once again the disputed item was verified-certified. I am convinced at this time, that either they are not conducting their investigation under the laws and guidelines set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or they are blowing me off. Whichever it may be they are violating my rights under the laws of the FCRA and are knowingly reporting inaccurate information and participating in unethical reporting practices.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The account information was disputed based on Date of delinquency, Date of last payment, Date last active which by XXXX does not match. I disputed the information with XXXX and Transunion and the investigation by XXXX came back to the credit bureaus that the account information is accurate. I live in CALIFORNIA and this information is inconsistent under the CCRAA. 

FCRA 623 and FDCPA 806 ( b ) Maximum Possible Accuracy state that the creditor MUST enter a notice of dispute.If this is not entered the account can not report on the account XXXX p. 2-2 Industry Reporting Standards '' All accounts must be reported on a monthly basis. '' The creditor XXXX did not update the account status as " disputed '' while I was shopping for a new home at which time I was denied a mortgage loan. 

FDCPA 809. Validation of debts ( b ) Disputed debts If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) of this section that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. Collection activities and communications that do not otherwise violate this subchapter may continue during the 30-day period referred to in subsection ( a ) unless the consumer has notified the debt collector in writing that the debt, or any portion of the debt, is disputed or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor. Any collection activities and communication during the 30-day period may not overshadow or be inconsistent with the disclosure of the consumers right to dispute the debt or request the name and address of the original creditor. 

This account should no longer be reporting because of the violation of my consumer rights under the CCRAA and the Rosenthal FDCPA

Consumer complaint narrative: We just refinanced with amerisave. They lost my first payment. I had to keep calling to see if they could find it, they never did. For my second payment I didnt get the bill until the day before it was due. I sent the check in right away and they still havent cashed it yet. I have made numerous calls to the company without a reasonable solution. They asked that I submit payments online, but when I tried to sign up for the online portal- the program could not locate my account information. The person whom I called about it said they would fix it and get back to me but no one ever did. I am very unhappy with this company and am nervous about my payments not being processed accurately.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased an excursion for Alaska  through XXXX/XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$450.00}. The transaction shows a date of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I bought insurance for the excursion from XXXX XXXX for {$26.00} on the same date ( XX/XX/XXXX ). The transaction date shows XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased another Alaska excursion through XXXX/XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$230.00}. The transaction date shows XX/XX/XXXX. 

I bought insurance for the excursion from XXXX XXXX for {$13.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. The transaction date shows XX/XX/XXXX. 

Totaling {$730.00} I purchased these excursions in XX/XX/XXXX for my XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX. The cruise was canceled and I rescheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. Instead of receiving a refund, the company said they would honor the two excursions for the XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I then received word from my travel agent in XX/XX/XXXX that XXXX/XXXX XXXX was in financial default and no one would be receiving their money or get their excursions. I was told by my agent to file a claim with the credit card company for a refund due to NOT receiving the services I paid for. I filed a claim by phone on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX I received notification that the claim was denied and closed. 

I went inside the bank this time on XX/XX/XXXX, to file another claim. I spoke to an associate who had to file the claim by phone. She explained to the person that I had not received the services for which I paid for and explained to them the business was in financial default under receivership ( State of Wisconsin ). The person told the associate the issue was between me and the merchant. She then reiterated that the business was in financial default. The claims person said they were not responsible for the Government shut down and refunding me the money. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to file a claim online with Wells Fargo. I can not do so because the online banking is not showing the transactions for those purchases. It shows all my other purchases, but not those mentioned above. I do have them on my XX/XX/XXXX bank statement. 

The debit/VISA credit card used was through Wells Fargo Bank. 

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo is inaccurately and unfairly reporting to credit bureaus and causing further debt entrapment to their customers. 

During the lockdown, I requested my loans be entered into a forbearance XXXX and I entered again from XXXX. XXXX did not communicate limits to this and subsequently removed them from this status resulting in 30-60-90 day late reporting. Again, no limits had been communicated to me or my co-signer, despite me making an additional request in XXXX to extend. 

When I inquired when/why these changes places to place, it took speaking to the XXXX to get an answer that wasn't " you need to pay these to bring them current ... that's all we know '' and I waited an additional 15 days to be told they had no intention of acknowledging their lack of compassion, communication, or damage to my credit report. In addition to catching them rack fees in my account and being issued a refund for multiple instances of these fee assessments, I believe Wells Fargo is a predatory bank that should be investigated. 

They are resolving themselves of their place in the student debt crisis and selling their student loan accounts to a third party -- leaving thousands of us with loans nearly in default to instead deal with collection agencies where additional fees will be added. 

This is unfair, inaccurate, and it should be examined further to prevent Wells Fargo from further profiting from it's predation.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: ARS I would like to once again ask to have all the documents you claim you have obtained and sent to me to confirm that this is an accurate. I have NOT once received anything from you showing the information you claim you have sent. You sent me a bill and that is it. A bill that said emergency services balance owed XXXX. I have not received any else supporting what you keep saying. Why would I now after all this time do all of the steps your telling me to do for identity theft three years later.? Why don't you take the steps and submit the documents that you keep refusing to send verifying the debt is mine. It would be a lot easier for you to provide those documents than me going and claiming identity theft three years later. I have spent those three years trying to get you to provide me documents with my signature verifying the debt belongs to me and for three years you just continue to send me a bill that says emergency services balance due. That means nothing. Again, I have maintained medical insurance for over five years, maybe even longer than that. So again. Show me more than a bill, And when I say that it means show me the entire MEDICAL RECORD you have on file verifying this debt and we can move on. Otherwise, stop updating my credit reports every month with XXXX. You have my information so you can send me the medical records from the date of service you have on there. Because I have not been to any emergency room.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
NRA National Recovery Agency did not verify my debt and reported me 2 times to all credit agencies for the same debt. 

At or around XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from NRA stating I owed {$250.00} to XXXX In which I did not know what they were referring to because their letter only stated XXXX {$250.00}. Send us a check. I thought it was a scam letter. I took it upon myself to investigate what they were talking about. I proceeded to logged into my old XXXX account and found out that I had a " XXXX '' balance on my account. Because I was under the impression that all my utilities bills were set up in automatic payment and there was no balance to be paid. I took a screenshot of what I saw and mailed them a copy and asked for validation. Instead, they proceeded to report Serious derogatory remarks upon my credit. Which is affecting me financially. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I send them a letter stating that do to the damages to my credit I will settle to pay an amount of {$200.00} dollars and a deletion of the bad reports to the credit boroughs. A very fair deal for both of us. 
A week later on XX/XX/XXXX I received a phone call from someone in the NRA collection agency stating they were on a capacity of supervisor in which they agreed to delete derogatory remarks on my credit and the {$200.00}. We had an agreement, and I asked them to send me a letter or an e.mail stating that they will delete derogatory remarks. They stated they couldn't or wouldn't put it in writing and that taking their word for it ; it was ok for me. My understanding is that if is not in writing is not legitimate. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I check my credit, and they made again a second derogatory remark. Affecting my credit further I now have a D rating on my credit. 

1. I believed that I asked for validation, and they didn't act in accordance to the credit fair federal rules.

2. I wanted things in writing instead they further affected my credit.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Background : My wife and I filed for chapter XXXX bankruptcy in XXXX. Meeting of creditors was XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, we petitioned to convert to a XXXX due to income changes. We converted back to a XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX after my income went up due to a new job. It should also be noted that I have an auto loan through XXXX that is paid outside of the Plan and all payments have been on time ( as accurately reported on the credit report by XXXX ) Issue : I had an unsecured credit line with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( aka XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) included in the bankruptcy. Starting in XXXX of XXXX ( after the XXXX meeting concluded ) XXXX began reporting the account as late/delinquent, though they were receiving distributions from the trustee and my payments were all on time. Additionally, the account is reporting 'open ', instead of 'included in bankruptcy '. I filed disputes with all 3 credit bureaus, twice, disputing both the delinquent payments and account status. XXXX has refused to make any changes. None of the other creditors included in the bankruptcy are reporting the accounts as past due or open. 

The new job I started in XX/XX/XXXX requires that I relocate. I am applying for a mortgage loan ( provided I meet all the criteria and am approved by the bankruptcy judge ). The incorrect reporting filed by XXXX is harming me by lowering my credit score hindering my ability to obtain approval for an FHA mortgage I otherwise should qualify for.

This has been going on for years and I have called XXXX on numerous occasions and they have verified the new due date however, this account continues to report my payments as lates. I have contacted XXXX  as well as the bureaus to fix this, but I have not been successful.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Short version : The company owes me money and is ignoring numerous methods of contacting them, all documented below. 

Details : LoanCare is my mortgage service provider. My loan was sold to them as, clearly, no sane person would choose to do business with LoanCare. My residence 's property taxes are due in XXXX, and we refinanced and closed this LoanCare loan on XX/XX/XXXX. The closing attorney for our new loan paid the property taxes in early XX/XX/XXXX, and then LoanCare *also* paid the property taxes. I have confirmed with the XXXX XXXX XXXX for XXXX XXXX, South Carolina that the closing attorneys payment was received first. Therefore, when the XXXX XXXX XXXX received the LoanCare payment from our escrow account, they sent a refund check to LoanCare on XX/XX/XXXX. 

That property tax refund belongs to us. Until LoanCare refunds us, we have essentially paid property taxes twice : once through the closing on the refinance and once through a full year 's worth of escrow that LoanCare collected with our monthly payments. Anyone can contact the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for XXXX XXXX to verify this. 

LoanCare 's website agrees that our mortgage with them is paid-off as of XX/XX/XXXX. Unfortunately, they are not showing the negative {$3800.00}. Even though they recognize that we don't owe them anything else, and our relationship should be over, they have not refunded the doubly-paid property taxes of {$3800.00}. 

I've contacted them : Friday, XX/XX/XXXX through their website 's contact form. The responded the next day through email with " Your information has been forwarded to the Tax Team. Please allow more time for further research and resolution. '' Friday XX/XX/XXXX through their website 's contact form. They responded similarly but with no solution. 

Numerous times through their phone system, but there's no way to talk to actual person. 

Through an email I found by searching on the internet ( also listed on their main XXXX page ). Sent an email to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I received a phone call from an odd number ( it was not the correct number of digits ) that left me a voicemail saying to call them back at their original phone number. Of course, that does not solve anything because it's an endless phone tree. There's no way to reach an actual person. 

Monday, XX/XX/XXXX through their website 's contact form. They responded with a short sentence about how they'd forward my inquiry to a team of specialists. No solution has come of this. 

Friday, XX/XX/XXXX through their website 's contact form. They responded with a short sentence about how they'd forward my inquiry to the tax team. No solution has come of this. 

Through an email XXXX on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. No response at all. 

Through two certified letters detailing every piece of information they'd need to write me the check I'm owed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I returned a XXXX XXXX XXXX as instructed by XXXX. XXXX had performed a preinspection and noted several minor repairs I should have completed before turn-in. I followed their direction and left all the documentation in the car front seat. XXXX still charged me for all the repairs. After several phone calls and multiple resubmissions of the documented receipts and pictures, XXXX finally removed most of the charges. I paid the lease termination fee of {$300.00} and a lost key for {$250.00} but XXXX continued to send me invoices each month. As you can see in the attached Experian report the balance changed almost monthly for no apparent reason or without any clear itemization. 

Finally, XXXX claimed that the roughly {$390.00} was for personal property tax. Since the State of VA prorates I ask XXXX to send me a statement of the tax record. They didn't send anything other than non-informational monthly statements. recently my credit score took a big hit 100+ points. After investigating I found that XXXX had charged off {$2800.00} dollars. 

I have escalated this to a supervisor who claims there is nothing they can do, I ask the supervisor who would not provide his name or case/claim number. I ask for the supervisor I was speaking with for the 3rd time and he said " she '' would call me. I have received no call. 

I ask XXXX to update the credit bureaus with the status of the account has been paid in full. XXXX agrees it's been paid in full but refuses to report this to the bureaus or have the {$2800.00} charge off. 

This was a 3-year lease. Not a single payment was ever late. 

Hoping you can help me. I have Federal Government clearances and that charge off could prevent me from obtaining future clearances to provide assistance to our Federal clients. I explained the serious nature of this to XXXX they didn't seem to care. Thank you for any help you can provide.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The credit card company XXXX XXXX XXXX  has reported two late payments to my credit report. I think this is incorrect and unfair reporting practices because of the fact that XXXX XXXX XXXX has admittedly been sending my credit statements to the wrong address. The representative that took my email address did not enter it in correctly ; therefore, I was unable to login/access my account for over a month. 

I called XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX after seeing that my credit report was updated with delinquent payments. I explained that I had not received a credit statement yet was reported delinquent. The rep proceeded to look into my account. She asked for my email address. I gave it. She then noticed they had the wrong email address. They spelled my name wrong in the email address. 

I have never had a late payment before or after this incident on this card. 

So, I then made a large payment covering half of my current balance and requested that the email address be corrected and that they remove the late payments on my credit. I was promptly sent a letter roughly one week later from XXXX XXXX saying they reporterd correctly and will not be removing the late payments. 

This is very shady business practices. It was clearly a clerical error on their part, which in turn prevented me from even being able to access my account information ( because my email address couldn't be used to set a password since the email was incorrect ). 

I had a near stellar payment history until this occurred. I am disgusted with XXXX XXXX 's lack of responsibility, which clearly occurred due to their representative lacking English language skills. Not speaking English is fine, but screwing up the spelling of a customer 's account information and then holding them accountable because you can't understand them is not acceptable. If I would have received my statements, the bill would have been paid on time, no questions asked.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX has incorrectly reported three ( 3 ) 90-day late payments on my credit report during a federally mandated suspension of all student loan repayments. When I contacted them to correct this error in their reporting, they refused to correct it. 

According to Section 3513 ( d ) of the CARES Act ( Public Law 116-136 ), federal student loan repayment suspensions were supposed to be reported to consumer reporting agencies positively ( i.e., as if the borrower has been making regular payments. In relevant part subsection ( d ) reads : During the period in which the Secretary suspends payments on a loan under subsection ( a ), the Secretary shall ensure that, for the purpose of reporting information about the loan to a consumer reporting agency, any payment that has been suspended is treated as if it were a regularly scheduled payment made by a borrower. 

CARES Act suspension of federal student loan repayment was extended until XX/XX/2021. 

XXXX has completely disregarded federal law and has ruined my credit. Given that they have made this fatal error in their reporting, I am respectfully requesting that this error be corrected and XXXX reflect the appropriate positive payment history.

When I pulled my credit report on XX/XX/2020 to see if it had been removed, I noticed that the hard inquiry was still there. So I called XXXX again on XX/XX/2020. They said they had already notified TransUnion that the hard inquiry was fraudulent ( after I had called on XX/XX/2020 ), but that it takes 60-90 days for the credit bureau to update their information. They also said they would notify all 3 credit bureaus again on that day ( XX/XX/2020 ). 

It has now been over 4 months since I notified both TransUnion AND XXXX. This fraudulent inquiry needs to be removed from my account ASAP, and I shouldn't have to spend so much time getting it fixed.
