Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have become aware that that the credit reporting agencies may not be in compliance with certain provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act XXXX FCRA XXXX and how it is reporting my credit information. 

In accordance of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 605. Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c ] ( a ) Information excluded from consumer reports. Except as authorized under subsection ( b ) of this section, no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : ( 1 ) Cases under title 11 [ United States Code ] or under the Bankruptcy Act that, from the date of entry of the order for relief or the date of adjudication, as the case may be, antedate the report by more than 10 years.

604. Permissible purposes of consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681b ] ( a ) In general. Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, or a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

With subsections 604 and 605, the credit reporting agencies did not get the information of my bankruptcy from the State of Tennessee nor did I express that information to be made public in any expressed written agreement or statement. The three credit reporting agencies received my personal credit information from public records which they are not in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Fair Credit Reporting Act states the regulation and laws that govern the three credit reporting agencies, however the misuse of personal information for financial gain harms consumers. I could not find a place to stay because that was on my credit report and reduce my score. I find it very difficult that I can not find a place to call home in a reasonable area do to the inconvenience of the misuse of my personal credit information.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX we closed on a refinancing with Eagle Bank for our single family home in XXXX MD. 

On XX/XX/XXXX we were informed that our loan had been sold to US Bank. The effective date of US Bank to start receiving payments was XX/XX/XXXX. Our loan number is XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was informed by email that USBank had disbursed {$1900.00} to XXXX XXXX for an insurance premium payout. 

Unfortunately, we do not have our homeowner 's insurance with XXXX XXXX. We have our insurance with XXXX 's and this payment was made by Eagle Bank on XX/XX/XXXX. 

In speaking with the poorly trained customer service department, I was informed that US Bank made a payment for the premium for the Master insurance policy for the Condo.

This property is not a Condominium, it is a single family home which could be easily checked by using XXXX or perhaps just reading the documents. 

Even if this was a condo, what Condo owner pays the premium for the Master Insurance Policy for the Association? The only premium a Condo owner would pay is for an HO6 policy.

The rep then asked me if my policy covered walls in or just the outside. Again, this is a single family home so this question shows a poor understanding of what is in a Condo policy vs a single family home policy. 

The rep found that my paperwork was processed incorrectly designating it as a Condo. Why that happened and what possessed anyone to send a payment for a premium for a Master policy when you aren't even processing my payments yet for the mortgage is unbelievable. 

We are very disturbed that you would send funds out of our account when you do not even have the account till XX/XX/XXXX. 

I spoke with a rep for US Bank on XX/XX/XXXX and was assured my paperwork would be updated and the funds returned to my account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email that US Bank has now sent another payment for homeowners insurance for {$1900.00} to XXXX XXXX. Still not our homeowners insurance policy. Called the bank on XXXX and they had no record of my request from XX/XX/XXXX. I asked for a lock on any more escor payments and that they had t get my authorization. They refused. I am now out {$3900.00} with no assurances when this money will be returned. I emailed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at the Bank with no response. 

US Bank has shown us so far very sloppy handling of our account, our funds and very poorly trained workers. Not what you want to see when you handle our escrow for insurance and taxes.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX, I contacted M & T Bank to see what options were available so that I would not have my house go into foreclosure. They failed to provide accurate information regarding workout options and foreclosure information. I asked about what options were open for me. They told me that I could not do a loan modification, Deed-in-lieu, Short-sale, or refinance. Different told me different things when I called the M & T Bank Mortgage department so options were told that they were unavailable to me and then they were, or I was too late because of the misinformation. I hired 3 different estate agents who listed the house. I had 2 people who made offers to buy the property for a percentage but, the bank refused saying that it was not enough. one offer was for {$18000.00} and the other was for {$30000.00}. Agents told me that many people didn't put in offers because the garage that is located near the property did not come with the house. So with no acceptable offers, the property went into foreclosure and in XX/XX/XXXX it was sold for {$24000.00}. The mortgage never included the garage located near the property but, as of XX/XX/XXXX, there was a survey completed showing that the garage is actually part of the property. The garage was never insured and only used 1 stall of the garage being that the other stall was used by the owner of other property, and believed to be owned by the owner of other nearby property that shares driveway next to the property. The power is connected to the other property. The garage was never included on the mortgage or appraisal for the mortgage. M & T Bank did not work with me or provide accurate information regarding workout options which have resulted in foreclosure on my credit report and preventing me from getting another home for me and my family.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I am contacting this agency for the third time in regard to the same problem, but with complaints about the said resolution of the institute at fault. My original issue was the forgery of my signature and the disbursement of my funds to an unknown and not intended for individual. All I have asked since I was made aware of his problem was documentation from Citibank as to where my funds were deposited. Please refer to complaint ID numbers XXXX and XXXX. The most recent response from the Citibank Executive Response team on XX/XX/21 was 1 ) a lie about my complaint and sending me a copy of the check in question 2. ) giving me a {$50.00} credit for their mistake. I have made it known to them that I have done everything they asked to resolve this issue and still an avoidance of answering where my check was deposited. I have repeatedly advised them that what was at issue here was the theft of my identity. Apparently, to them, my identity is only worth {$50.00}. I believe now that their bill payment system needs to be taken down as their clients can not trust that their money will be sent to who it was intended and they will never be held accountable for it. I have now submitted my complaint to the FTC and will continue moving up the ladder. Unfortunately, as much as government agencies were created to help the average consumer, I have not found that to be true. I'll finish by saying that I too work for the government and I am proud to help serve the residents of my community, after all that is my job and I do it with diligence and respect..

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
1. 0n XX/XX/XXXX my wife and I put our house into forbearance due to my wife having her work hours cut due to the XXXX XXXX. 
2. At the end of XX/XX/XXXX, I called my mortgage company, US Bank, to start the process of getting out of my forbearance. I was initially told that since I had a VA loan, the mortgage company was waiting for guidance from VA on how to proceed with modifying VA loans that were put into forbearance. The representative asked if I could start making payments and I said I could. I started making payments again in XX/XX/XXXX. 
3. I called every week to get a status update and every week I received a different answer about what was being done with my forbearance. 
4. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from a representative asking what I was able to do/not do where my forbearance was concerned. I was told it would take thirty days to complete my evaluation. 
5. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from a representative stating that my loan modification had been approved, I should be receiving paperwork from underwriting within thirty days and that I didn't need to make a payment for XXXX but I would for XXXX. 
6. On XX/XX/XXXX I had yet to receive any paperwork from underwriting but I still made a payment for XXXX. 
7. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from underwriting, stating the terms of my loan modification, I had until XX/XX/XXXX to appeal the modification and I didn't need to make a payment until XXXX. I didn't appeal the modification. The paperwork also stated that I would receive more paperwork by XX/XX/XXXX, for my wife and I to sign for the loan modification. 
8. As of this date, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I have yet to receive any paperwork for my wife and I to sign to resolve this forbearance. 
9. I have called and emailed numerous times and even filed a complaint, within US Bank, and I still keep getting the same answer that they are working on it. 
10. This paperwork should have been started on XX/XX/XXXX, since I didn't appeal the loan modification. 

Now eight months later, we are no farther along than when we requested to end the forbearance.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: Hi, I have reach-out XXXX XXXX since XXXX. I have sent letters asking to show a contract with them with my wet-ink signature. They refuse to acknowledge. I recently sent an affidavit of notice dispute the debt received on XX/XX/XXXX. Tracking number is XXXX. They did not answer. An Non-respond affidavit in commerce is accept the complaint as true. Receipt of this AFFIDAVIT OF TRUTH & FACT requires a response as stipulated above, acquiescence will be your answer to all below statements if respondents fail or refuse to provide a written response in the form of a rebuttal Affidavit. Acquiescence means A persons tacit or passive acceptance ; implied consent to an act. Review Morris vs. NCR, 44 SW2d 433 which states : An Affidavit if not contested in a timely manner is considered undisputed facts as a matter of law. Also, review U.S. vs. Pruden, 424 F.2d 1021 ( XXXX ) which states : Silence can only be equated with fraud where there is a legal or moral duty to speak or where an inquiry left unanswered would be intentionally misleading. XXXX XXXX did not rebuttal any point-to-point answer with their own affidavit. I also filed a postmaster criminal complaint under title code 18 U.S.C ss 1342 fictitious name and address and title 18 U.S.C. ss 1341 Fraud and swindling. XXXX XXXX only sent a general letter that does not address any of my complaints or any proof of a sign contract. Under the Law, there must be a signed contract for them to collect a debt. WHERE IS THE CONTRACT SIGNED BY ME. SHOW ME THE PROOF? I finally filed a U.C.C. 1 financial statement with the ILLINOIS SECRETARY OF STATE placing a lien on my estate claim the name. I also filed with the ILLINOIS SECRETARY OF STATE COMMON LAW TRADEMARK AND COPY RIGHT NOTICE. The Illinois has accepted the filing and the lien number is XXXX and XXXX. XXXX XXXX will have to a do a U.C.C Lien search to get confirmation. ILL and certified the lien on XXXX time XXXX XXXX.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed a delinquent status on my credit report. I could not access it online because the account was closed and I had no record of the number. I called XXXX immediately. The first THREE people I spoke to could not help me. My account was not in their " region. '' They also could not even find my account number because it was closed out. 

Finally, I spoke to XXXX XXXX Employee # XXXX XXXX. He credited the account in full {$160.00} and told me it would take 24 hours to reflect to give notice of hat happened. I was told that the account was inactive and there was " no reason to charge when account was cancelled and de-activated. '' I was also told that it was a " non-collections credit '' and he was unable to send a note or email to me since it was applied manually. It seemed to be a systems limitation. So he gave me his employee number. 

I called Contract Callers twice to resolve this. The account was removed from two of my credit bureau reports, but not XXXX. Then it showed up on an XXXX  report again. Contract Callers told me they were waiting for XXXX to verify this information. It has now been over a month and I have not been able to get this resolved. It is still on my credit report, and I am in the process of signing a commercial lease for my business, so i really need this resolved since this was done completely erroneously.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: Due to financial hardships, I decided to turn in a car I could no longer afford. The car was returned to the lending company and an agreement made to pay monthly payments in the amount of {$50.00}. A few months into the arrangement, I was asked to increase my payments. I refused because I did not want to agree to a payment I could not afford. Therefore I continued making payments until XX/XX/2019. In XXXX of XXXX the company stop accepting my payments. My online account was disabled and I was told by a collection representative that payments were no longer being accepted and they were pursuing another means of collecting the payment. I tried for several weeks to speak with a supervisor. I was talked to in a very unprofessional manner from several representatives to include the supervisor. I asked for statements and records of my account and was never sent that information. In XXXX I received an email from my HR department notifying me of a garnishment for this account. Days later I received a letter from the company about the garnishment. I attempted to appeal the decision and make several settlement offers but each offer was denied and countered with an amount not much less than the balance this company claim I owed. I've since attempted to offer a settlement but again was countered with an amount not much less than one of the balances this company has reported I owed. The amount the company says I owe is always higher than the amount reported to the credit bureau.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a stay at home mom, who doesnt work and Bank Of America lied to me and contradicts everything they tell me. 

on XXXX of XXXX I called Bank of America in regards of my account. The representative explained to me he saw some charges on my account. I replied and said I didnt authorize those charges. 

The rep then stated he will submit a refund and within 90 days they will CONTACT THE MERCHANT and after contacting the merchant, they will then make a decision before closing the case. 

On XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX, BANK OF AMERICA reversed the refund which resulted my account being overdraft and they charge me an overdraft fee. ( {$69.00} was the refund ). I then received my stimulus check and because they took back the refund they gave me, my account was in the NEGATIVES and BANK OF AMERICA gave me a credit so My account will be positive again so I can get my full stimulus check. ( if they contacted the merchant and verified the merchant was already paid by my bf, then none of this would of happened ) the temporary credit was for {$43.00} which will end on XX/XX/XXXX ( all of this because no one reached out to the merchant and they caused my account to be in the negatives ) called Bank of America and was told, they NEVER CONTACTED the merchant because there was no urgency. I explained thats NOT what I was told and I was told they would reach out to the merchant before closing the case. 

I was advised that I would now have to submit my documents so they can reopen the case and that it would take up to 45 days I submitted the documents within one week of speaking to the agent. Then was told within 4 business days they would have a decision.

I called back within 5 business days and then was told 10 business days for a decision. I called back again and now was told 45 days again. ( Everyone keeps giving me new days of when this will be resolved ) Now XX/XX/XXXX is close and they will take back the credit of {$43.00} which will make my account go in the NEGATIVES again while they research the claim. For some reason no one can listen to all the calls I made where every agent in the claims department provided different information to me that contradicts what the last person said. And now Bank of America owes me {$69.00} and wants me to pay {$43.00} because of the overdraft fee they caused in my account. 


I was NEVER advised back in XXXX that they needed any documents! No one reached out and explained that I could of faxed them the documents, I only faxed them my documents because the case was reopen since they closed it!

Also, to have it removed or deleted the representative told me that it was something that was available upon request which I did request However, only to find out that this has not been removed or deleted from my credit. The last report showed that it was indeed paid in full but also as an active account which is not the truth. According to my research this is a UDAAP violation when there is Deceptive Acts of Practice which was very misleading for me and an very unnecessary process to do the things that I need to do.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I returned a XXXX XXXX XXXX as instructed by XXXX. XXXX had performed a preinspection and noted several minor repairs I should have completed before turn-in. I followed their direction and left all the documentation in the car front seat. XXXX still charged me for all the repairs. After several phone calls and multiple resubmissions of the documented receipts and pictures, XXXX finally removed most of the charges. I paid the lease termination fee of {$300.00} and a lost key for {$250.00} but XXXX continued to send me invoices each month. As you can see in the attached XXXX report the balance changed almost monthly for no apparent reason or without any clear itemization. 

Finally, XXXX claimed that the roughly {$390.00} was for personal property tax. Since the State of VA prorates I ask XXXX to send me a statement of the tax record. They didn't send anything other than non-informational monthly statements. recently my credit score took a big hit 100+ points. After investigating I found that XXXX had charged off {$2800.00} dollars. 

I have escalated this to a supervisor who claims there is nothing they can do, I ask the supervisor who would not provide his name or case/claim number. I ask for the supervisor I was speaking with for the 3rd time and he said " she '' would call me. I have received no call. 

I ask XXXX to update the credit bureaus with the status of the account has been paid in full. XXXX agrees it's been paid in full but refuses to report this to the bureaus or have the {$2800.00} charge off. 

This was a 3-year lease. Not a single payment was ever late. 

Hoping you can help me. I have Federal Government clearances and that charge off could prevent me from obtaining future clearances to provide assistance to our Federal clients. I explained the serious nature of this to XXXX they didn't seem to care. Thank you for any help you can provide.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted Americollect XXXX XX/XX/2021 at XXXX ET concerning a collections account that was on my XXXX  credit report. I spoke with XXXX, one of their Collections Analysts. After inquiring with respect to the stated account she affirmed that Americollect would immediately update the account with the credit Bureau as paid the same day before the close of business, if I opted for their 'Pay for Delete, which I did. Following XXXX 's guarantee that Americollect would update the account with the credit reporting agencies and expedite my request, I concurred to pay off the account in full, as agreed. It was brought to my attention that if I made the payment over the phone with her that I would not be able to be supplied a payment confirmation nor would it post the same day. Preceding this disclosure I elected to make the payment on their customer portal with the credentials she furnished for my account. I requested that XXXX stay on the line to ensure that the payment was processed successfully. Upon receiving my confirmation from Americollect 's site while still on the phone with XXXX, she confirmed that the payment was posted to their system. XXXX then certified that the " Pay for Delete '' would be sent today ( same day XX/XX/XXXX ) and should be removed from my report in one to two business days.

Having seen no updates to my credit file, confirmation from Americollect or XXXX  account I determined to contact Americollect XXXX XX/XX/2021 seeking an update. I was transferred to XXXX, Collections Analyst who advised me my payment and " pay for delete '' update was not submitted until Monday XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX was instructed of the expectation, terms and arrangements coordinated and set in stone with XXXX on XXXX XX/XX/2021 at XXXX XXXX. She admonished me that the details which were provided to me were inaccurate. Being that they would not expedite anything to the Credit Bureaus, all payments made to Americollect whether online or over the phone are not processed until after 48 hours, and ultimately the payment posted date, in which I confirmed was received by Americollect after my payment. 

Succeeding this exchange with XXXX, I then requested to be placed with a Manager or Supervisor as a result of my dissatisfaction with my pledged expectations being unmet. Subsequent to my transfer I was connected to XXXX, Americollect Supervisor to express my great disenchantment and hurt. She went on to restate the particulars and details shared by XXXX. 

The FCRA law ensures that bureaus report 100 % accurate credit information. This is unfairly penalizing my credit score and I am requesting the account be removed as agreed upon and updated now. I have attached a copy of my payment confirmation to this file. All calls are recorded for quality and training purposes, so if need be I am requesting that the call be pulled from XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX ET.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: My complaint involves Bank of America reporting a closed savings or checking account ( I believe ) for suspected fraud activity although I have reported to them that this account is not mine and must be the result of ID theft. When I found out about this reporting I alerted XXXX  via online dispute and Bank of America sent a one page internal screenshot of a form with my name typed into it. So XXXX  marked as verified although I am not sure how that verified anything. Subsequently, I called Bank of America and after several hours I finally got to report the account as fraudulent and I was sent a Uniform ID Theft form to be filled out, signed, and returned with a copy of my ID ; which I did. A couple of weeks later I receive a letter from Bank of America saying that no ID theft was detected and this blemish remains on my consumer reports ( i.e. XXXX, XXXX, etc. ) although Bank of America has amended to include SETTLED IN FULL in the Closure Status line. How is this legal, moral, just, or ethical? Bank of America has yet to tell me why this was even suspected of fraudulent activity. All I have received from them is that one page mentioned earlier. Nothing that I signed, no real account info, nor any kind of insight into why they are refusing to remove this against proper procedure and various consumer protection laws. I have been forced to postpone the opening of a law practice and other business ventures due to this incorrect and fraudulent reporting. I can not obtain a proper business bank account and take advantage of business banking offers, etc. Moreover ( and more importantly ), I have no chance at being able to open an XXXX account for my law practice, thus costing me substantially. Not to mention as an attorney and seeking employment, having a suspected fraud negatively reporting on my consumer reports is long dead end road that I did not even know I was on. I have even sent Bank of America a verification page that my info/data was stolen in the XXXX Data Breach of 2017 among other numerous data breaches. This account is not, was not, and will never be mine. I don't know what else to do to get Bank of America to understand this. It seems to be some one of those internally started accounts probably for some promo for sales people or something. I DON'T KNOW! ALL I DO KNOW IS I ( THE PERSON THEY ARE NEGATIVELY REPORTING IT AGAINST ) HAD NOR HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH IT AND IT'S NOT RIGHT THAT THIS BIG BANK WHO GLADLY RECEIVED OUR BAILOUT FUNDS CAN NOT HAVE PROPER PROCEDURES IN PLACE TO ENSURE THESE THINGS DON'T HAPPEN AND WHEN THEY DO MAKE SURE THEY ARE NIPPED IN THE BUD AND NOT AFFECTING THE LIVES OF EVERYDAY PEOPLE JUST TRYING TO MAKE IT. IT'S DISGRACEFUL, DISGUSTING, SHAMEFUL, AND UNJUST

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Citi Bank has been calling me every single day for the last 8 months, and they need to stop. They are never going to see another dime from me, so they may as well give up. The money they're claiming I owe them is from disputes I had filed that they completely mishandled. Due to COVID-19 and the stores ' policies at the time, I could not help the fact that stores were not accepting returns for clothing, food, and anything sanitary-related ... I also could not help that restaurants I went to sucked and they could not get their orders straight, or that they gave me food that was horrible quality, etc. 

With many disputes I had filed, I showed supporting documentation of my claim, and they STILL denied my disputes, just because the merchants responded showing bill of sale! Zero of my disputes argued that I did not authorize the purchases. They all were filed under different categories. So basically, the merchants would respond to my dispute unaccordingly, completely dodging my reasons for disputing, and Citi would automatically find in favor of said merchant!! 

I'm glad they closed my account, because I was going to close it anyway as I refuse to do business with XXXX  ... The purpose of this complaint is for Citi to stop calling me. If they want me to pay off my so-called debt, then they can either transfer it to a collection agency or not. Either way, there is absolutely no reason to be calling me every XXXX day, every day for 8 months. And either way, they're not getting my money. I will dispute the debt to the credit bureaus if need be ... 

Also, a response from the company will not be necessary. Although I'm sure they'll be brazen enough to respond, and their response will not be read.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Im writing because we are customers of Suntrust for over 18 years. We even referred a few people to you including our son! We currently have two mortgages with them and have been trying to refinance them both since XXXX. 
Weve sent our information a few different times, and each time we reach out theres a different reason the re-fis havent been completed.Its always us reaching out for an update and this week were told we need to send all our information again. 
This is unacceptable. The last time we called they said they were waiting for HELOC information. My husband had a conference call with them and the HELOC bank. Theyre now asking for our information a third time. This is unfair, and Im not sure why were being mistreated like this. Its a bait and switch and they keep us hanging out there while our insurance and escrows went unpaid and lapsed. We had to call and get those corrected too. I want them to schedule closing for these immediately.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife and I chose Wells Fargo because they were able to match a great rate to refinance my home mortgage. They are also the current holder of my home mortgage. Throughout the process, I was told repeatedly that the " Other Costs '' associated with my refinance would be waived ( {$0.00} ) because I am already a Wells Fargo customer. This gave them a significant edge over the other lender quotes I received. I received this correspondence multiple times throughout this refinance process ( XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ). 

Well, it is now time to close ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and those fees are still there. I am now out an appraisal fee and 3 months of correspondence. I have made it known that I will not be going through with the refinance if those fees are included on my loan since the beginning, so this should not be a surprise to anyone I have talked to at Wells Fargo. I am receiving the response of " There is nothing we can do '', which is just not good enough for me. I should not be penalized for incorrect information. I will continue to go through the appropriate channels until I receive and adequate solution.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
My checking account with M & T bank has been compromised by XXXX twice in less than three months. It started on XX/XX/XXXX for {$.00}, {$1.00}, and {$19.00}. I was able to report and to leave email telling them to remove the charges but I was upset because M & T had nothing on its menu or online to report fraud. 

On XX/XX/XXXX an XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX hit my account for {$.00} and {$3.00}. Again I tried to contact M & T to no avail. Because Covid, reaching customer Service was impossible. I spent hours trying to reach them for over a week! I tried continuously and was really upset because my social security check is deposited in this same checking account! 
Finally, I called my local branch and a one of the female employee returned my call and resolved the issues. I told her what had happened. 
I received my stimulus check direct deposited into this same account. The check for {$600.00} I never received. I went to the IRS website and saw that I qualified. One suggestion on the IRS website said to ask your bank if they.received the funds. 
No answer. 
My mother who is XXXX also has an account with M & T. She wrote a check to a charity in XX/XX/XXXX. It was cashed later at XXXX XXXX XXXX and changed from {$100.00} to {$7600.00} in XXXX. M & T told use because it was check fraud, it would take 90 days to return her funds. When we called back in 90 days, M & T stated their investigator was on vacation and it would be handles upon his return. Nothing happened. No money went back into my Mom 's account. 
Last week, an investigator from XXXX XXXX called and asked us about the case. M & T had lied to us. They had never done an investigation!! In two days, my mom had her money back. since XX/XX/XXXX!!!! 
Something is going on. Senor citizens are being targeted! My mom had a similar problem with XXXX XXXX XXXX for alot less money. 
I am XXXX and my mom is XXXX.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I am an Ally Bank customer ( digital bank ). Since there are no physical locations, and I needed a cashier 's check to make my first payment for an apartment, I ordered a cashier 's check over the phone. When I began the process, the agent confirmed my account, including my address in Colorado. I have lived at this address for over 6 months, and I updated my address with Ally Bank at that time. Previously, I resided in XXXX, OK. After confirming my Colorado address, the agent finished the process of sending me the cashier 's check made out to the apartment complex, and I paid for expedited shipping because my move-in date was about 5 days away. The day before my move-in, when I had still not received my check, I called Ally and they gave me the tracking number. This revealed that they sent the check to XXXX, OK. The agents I spoke to that day confirmed that this was entirely their error. The address on file was the correct Colorado address ; however, their cashier check system is a separate system that was not updated on their end, and somehow even though I confirmed my address with the agent, she must have still used the Oklahoma address later on in the phone call without ever notifying me of the same. Ally is refusing to refund the money and is requiring a notarized affidavit from the payee who is not willing to do so. The loss of this check is 100 % Ally Bank 's negligence and fault as they have confirmed, yet the refuse to refund my account with the {$2600.00} they withdrew for the lost check.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have two CitiCards. An Awards ( ... XXXX ) card and a CitiAdvantage Card ( ... XXXX ) Sometime in early 2020, before XXXX, my card ending in XXXX, that I had not used for over 5 years was paid off complete. 

Payments were being made automatically to both accounts from my XXXX XXXX Checking Account. For some reason after the paying off my card ending in XXXX, my payments to card XXXX ( CitiAdvantage ) were being applied to my XXXX card. I discovered this error and contacted Citi, who promised to move the credit in XXXX to XXXX and update my payment history accordingly. Citi moved the credit to XXXX on XX/XX/2020, or thereabouts, but never updated my payment history as promised. As a result I immediately received a 60-90 past due on my credit report, which I did not know of until recently. 

Furthermore, my card ending in XXXX had received activity that was fraudulent after the XXXX correction. I never received a statement or notification in the mail about any activity. The disputed amount was reported to the credit agencies as still past due as recently as XX/XX/2021, however upon notifying Citi, their fraud department and customer service departments tell me that I have a negative {$35.00} balance ( credit ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received two letters from Citi ( attached ) stating that my credit information is correct and that I need to contact the credit agencies to let them know I'm disputing the information. 

I spoke with Citi again, XXXX - XXXX PST on XX/XX/2021 and was sent from department to department speaking to representatives in their fraud and customer services department only to be disconnected without resolution. 

I fear this really indicates Citi 's lack of security protocols and their inability to have any oversight to their credit card billing and management systems. Their lack of knowledge about their own processes is grossly expressed as their representatives appear to be mouthpieces to only drive their customers to give up due to their corporate direction of not really caring about their clients concerns. I am sure that I am not the only one going through this exhaustive process to right the wrong due to their negligence. 

I hope this is enough information to start this investigation. 

I plan on re-calling them as soon as send out this statement. 

All of the above can be confirmed if Citi releases all phone recordings and transcripts of my discussions and actions with them since XX/XX/2020. 

I can offer a copy of my credit report if needed. Every other creditor reports exceptional payment history except Citi. 

Best Regards ... ... ..

XX/XX/XXXX - The principal only payment was corrected and the loan was paid to below {$84000.00}.

XX/XX/XXXX - I called your customer service line and spoke with XXXX who transferred me to the supervisor XXXX. I was told me request for PMI removal would be escalated. 

Since then I have called seven more times ( XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX again and XX/XX/XXXX ). I have spoken with 11 different people ( XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX- supervisor, XXXX , XXXX- Supervisor, XXXX XXXX , XXXX XXXX , XXXX, XXXX- supervisor , XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ) to find out why my PMI request on XX/XX/XXXX had not been addressed. All 11 of those people stated they would either call me or email me back, and the only one that did is XXXX XXXX who called me back once to tell me she did not have an update for me. 

I paid my loan down to the amount you requested, well within the time frame you asked me to pay it down within, and I submitted a request in writing ( as shown below ) also well within that requested timeframe. Please tell me why I need to pay for another vacation.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I had to file bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX  2020 due to income reduction. There were several credit card accounts that I had paid the balances in full prior to the filing. My issue is ALL of these accounts are reflecting " Account Included in Bankruptcy '' when there was no balance owed on the disputed accounts. I addressed this fact with the Credit Reporting Agency in my dispute filings. My credit report on all but one of the accounts in question doesn't even reflect my payment history on them. There is no mention that the accounts were paid off ; only that they are in bankruptcy. It's not right that these accounts are noted with negative remarks when the accounts were closed by Grantors when they were in good standing. I feel the remarks referencing " bankruptcy '' should be removed on these accounts and the accounts be moved to the Satisfactory Accounts list in my report. I had added a Consumer Statement to my Credit Report stating the fact that these accounts were paid off. But, since it isn't seen until the very end of the Credit Report a Creditor would have to scan down through several pages of " Inquiries '' to even know it exists! No one is going to see this statement.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My rights under the FCRA are being violated. Not only are these accounts not mine. I have not supplied proof under the doctrine of estopple by silence Englehardt v. Gravens ( Mo ) 281 SW 715, 719, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. Not only that but section 15 UCS 1681 ( 2 ) excludes the reporting of the transactions with corporations.

as my right under federal law.

Under 15 USC 1681 ( a ) congress defines a consumer report as the term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for.. 
Understand that by this law, XXXX is included because you provide this consumer report and you are a consumer reporting agency! Under 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ), it also mentions exclusions pertaining to consumer reporting. I am quoting directly from congress so understand that your reporting is a federal violation based on laws put in place by congress.

15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) i excludes the reporting of report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report. 
The term person means any individual, partnership, corporation, trust, estate, cooperative, association, government or governmental subdivision or agency, or other entity. 
All of the companies listed below are CORPORATIONS as defined by congress as a person Therefore the transactions between the consumer ( me ) and these corporations should not be on my consumer report under FEDERAL LAW! You are in direct breach of the federal laws put in place to protect the consumer.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX the XXXX of XXXX I contacted my lender Lakeview Loan Company regarding my escrow overpayment. I was informed that the escrow team had not started on my overpayment and it probably wouldnt happen till the beginning of the new year. I enquired as to why this would take them so long to process my escrow return. The agent informed me that the company would also be preforming the escrow reevaluation at that time. I stated I understand and I would wait time after the start of the new year. On XXXX the XXXX XXXX, I received a letter from LAKEVIEW Loan company stating that I should have a check cut and sent out within the next 20 business days. Due to holidays and weekends I waited till XX/XX/XXXX, to contact LAKEVIEW Loan company regarding my overpayment check and the fact my escrow amount was evaluated as increasing. I questioned why the check had not been cut as of yet and was told the check definitely should have been cut. The LAKEVIEW Loan agent stated that they would put in the order to cut the check and it should take 48 hours. I then addressed the fact my escrow amount increased even though I do not pay property tax under the states homesteading laws. The agent stated that they would put in a request to do a reevaluation of my escrow. I stated that would be fine. It is now XXXX the XXXX XXXX, i emailed LAKEVIEW Loan company that they still have not cut my escrow repayment check or reevaluated my escrow payments. I informed LAKEVIEW Loan company that they had 48 hours to rectify these issues or I would contact the CFPB regarding the violation of XXXX. It is now XX/XX/XXXX, and I still have not heard from LAKEVIEW Loan company regarding my escrow repayment. During these uncertain times the money that I have overpaid my Loan company could really be used to help my family.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
We applied for the Forbearance six-month plan in XX/XX/2020 due to the financial hardship that we confronted. We were very thankful for this help. However, it is conducting us into deeper financial debt, and all due to the loan agency 's delay response. 
Development of events : -We called Lakeview Loan Servicing in XX/XX/2020 to inform them that we no longer needed this plan and were ready to start paying back our mortgage. The person that answered the call confirmed that he was going to send us the Forbearance cancelation document. And that in the mid-time, he was going to extend the program for another six months. The extension was to cover the time that the review was going to take. 
-We received the documentation by the end of XXXX. We sent Lakeview Loan Servicing all the required documents in XXXX. 
-We called in XXXX inquiring for more information. We were interviewed by one of your agents, that confirmed that all documents were in order and that we just needed to wait for a package in the mail. The package was to contain documents that needed to be Notarized by a Notary Public and send them back. 
-We have made several calls without any useful information, we were only informed that it was still at the underwriting department. 

It's been more than 3 months since we sent them all the documents. 
It's been 5 months since we made our first attempt to start paying. 
Our debt to Lakeview Loan Services is increasing as we are writing this note. 
One of your agents told us that we should not have gone through another Forbearance. and that he could not understand why we were advised to do this.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice for Proof of Claim Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX Service # XXXX To Whom it may Concern : This is a this complaint is submitted Under OHIO LAW U.C.C 1319.12 Taking assignment of debts States ( C ) No collection agency shall commence litigation for the collection of an assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness unless it has taken the assignment in accordance with all of the following requirements : Credit contracts are non-assignable even if the contract has a clause for assignability because it violates the contract Law. Where there is no fair valuable consideration given, the contract or agreement is void ab inito. The debt is non-transferable. If it is a contract for credit or goes to the character of the parties, it can not be transferred or assigned. No state can make a law impairing contracts, Under OHIO LAW U.C.C 1319.12 Taking assignment of debts ( 3 ) The assignment was manifested by a written agreement separate from and in addition to any document intended for the purpose of listing the account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness with the collection agency. The written agreement shall state the effective date of the assignment and the consideration paid or given, if any, for the assignment and shall expressly authorize the collection agency to refer the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness to an attorney admitted to the practice of law in this state for the commencement of litigation. The written agreement also shall disclose that the collection agency may consolidate, for purposes of filing an action, the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness with those of other creditors against an individual debtor or co-debtors. 
Dartmouth College v. Woodward 4 Wheat 518 : White v. Hart, 13 Id 646. Once the Creditor writes off a debt, it can not be assigned or Collected. Since this is an error I demand that you send me the following proofs. As you are obligated to do in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practice Act. Section 1692 ( g ) : Under the Law, FDCPA, Section 1692 ( g ), you have 30 days to supply these proofs, if more time is needed please contact me by certified mail and I will extend you 15 extra days. I also request to see a certified copy of any contract or agreement between you and the original creditor that gave you the right to collect this debt.

Consumer complaint narrative:
There was an inquiry on my XXXX  credit report from XX/XX/2020, that was a result of identity theft. I discovered this during a review of my credit report. I called XXXX and they told me to contact the reporting company. I immediately put a freeze on my credit reports. I called Credco who made the inquiry and was told that the inquiry was from XXXX XXXX. I spoke to the dealership manager who told me about the applicant who applied for the credit. I verified my information and proved it was not me who applied for the credit. I spoke to Credco and was told to file a police report and a report with Identitytheft.gov. I did both of these and emailed them the reports asking them to remove the inquiry from my credit report. 

When I spoke to XXXX at Credco today, she told me that they now require me to send them a copy of my social security number, my driver 's license, and a copy of a utility bill. I told her that they never requested that information before and asked her if I sent them the additional documents if they would immediately remove the inquiry from my report and she was not able to guarantee me that they would. I told her that the information they are requesting is very sensitive and I do not feel comfortable releasing this information to a company that has not been authorized to receive this information and they could use it to further steal my identity now that they have a copy of my social security card, driver 's license, and utility bill. How can I be sure that they are not part of the identity theft scam? 

In essence, I told her that they are re-victimizing me by refusing to remove a fraudulent inquiry in spite of proof from a police report which they requested.

Product: Student loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was falsely under the impression that this loan was under a deferment or forbearance like other student loans during this international crisis. Apparently, this did not apply to my private student loan. 

This company, Mohela, has put me in financial dire straights before, forced me into bankruptcy, and caused immense amounts of stress on my family due to their horrible communication practices and unwillingness to assist in any way. 

In XXXX, I filed for bankruptcy under pressure from a defaulted student loanwith Mohela. This student loan had fallen into bad standing as I had called Mohela to file for an economic forbearance option and was not informed I had only placed this option on the federal student loan held by Mohela, not the private student loans they also serviced. 

I came out of bankruptcy in XXXX, expecting to have accounts reset and be able to start with a fresh slate, and Mohela had not done any of these things as my other accounts with other creditors had. My forbearances were never reset, I was out of any available options when financial hardships arose, as they had already exhausted these options prior to and during the bankruptcy. 

When the bankruptcy period was over, and payments resumed for this loan, they were entirely too high for my family to afford. We contacted Mohela to put a payment adjustment in place, and they do for a time, but it expires, and each time, we file for a new modification. They want more and more information, and they do not contact us to tell us it's missing. You must log in to the website to find details. 

This year, as stated before, I erroneously thought this company would be giving us relief due to the pandemic, and instead, what they did could only be considered postal harassment. We tried to apply for a payment deferment in XXXX, a payment modification, anything to help get us through, and they denied us for missing income verification. 

Now we are receiving letters telling me I have defaulted on this loan, and to contact the legal department, during a global pandemic, during an unprecedented time, and during a time when student loans were supposed to be offering relief. 

I am feeling backed into a corner here. They offer no options to help.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
As a former XXXX XXXX for 36 years, I am writing to report what I feel are unfair and deceptive acts or practices made by both Citi Bank and XXXX XXXX. 
I recently received notification from the banks referenced above that my credit line has been lowered due the reasons listed below : Proportion of balances to credit limits is too high on bank revolving or other revolving accounts Lack of recent installment loan information Amount owed on revolving accounts is too high Time since most recent account opening is too short This deceptive practice is balance chasing which means that instead of freeing up credit, the customer has less available credit due to the lower credit limit. The banks are beginning to engage in this practice to limit their risk by reducing the amount of a particular borrowers available credit. 

Balance chasing is more likely to occur if the cardholder makes larger payments or may appear to be a high-risk borrower who makes late payments or defaults on other credit cards or loans. An unintended consequence of balance chasing is that even though debt repayment is responsible consumer behavior, it can make it difficult improve a credit score, such a FICO score. 

Another issue with this is that my credit utilization has increased since the banks reduced my credit line. It has also impacted my credit score making it much more difficult to be approved for credit so that I may consolidate my debt as I have done in the past. It is just a matter of time before I see a rate hike due to this unfair practice. 
My credit history has been solid, so it is not clear to me as to why there is a lack of recent installment loan information seeing that I had two automobile loans from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and was paid in full on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, respectively. 

Please note that as of XX/XX/XXXX my credit score was XXXX and is currently reporting at XXXX as of XX/XX/XXXX. I have always made my payments in a timely manner and my credit has remained in good standing for many years despite what is stated above. 
The average age of my accounts is 7 years and 5 months with the oldest account 17 years and 6 months. 

My newest account was opened recently at a furniture store back on XX/XX/XXXX. I also had two personal loans I took out with XXXX XXXX that were paid in full as of XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 

I understand that the economic conditions have worsened due to the COVID-19 pandemic and that may be a reason for banks showing their reluctance to lend. However, consumers that reflect a solid credit history with favorable credit scores should not be penalized. This appears to be another tactic to raise their interest rates and bottom line.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: My account went past due, due to issues with the mail. I called up to pay over the phone. I asked to pay the account off and to close the account. The lady told me the payoff amount which I paid, however the account couldn't be closed until the payment cleared. Which is not true for revolving credit lines, they can be closed with a balance. A few months later I opened a plain envelope to discover that I had a balance of several dollars. I called and they could not waive due to previous late fees waivers. I explained it was due to bank error and I am not responsible for a bank mistake. They had taken my payment as an account payoff. I asked for a return call from a supervisor since none was available. I never received one, nor did I receive one the next time I asked. I am trying to refinance my home and due to the impact of the delinquency on my credit card I did not qualify for the cheapest loan. I had to take one that is {$3000.00} more expensive in closing costs. The refinance can not close until this balance is gone. I called again today and paid the balance since they refuse to resolve the {$1.00} residual interest error that is now {$8.00} with more fees and interest. This is predatory and unacceptable practices. I would like the delinquency removed from my credit report and the {$8.00} refunded to me.

As I stated, in the original complaint, this account is fraudulent. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15USC 1692g. The company responded to this complaint via email and subsequently on this complaint. The representative stated, " Our records show that Spotloan made a loan in your name on XX/XX/XXXX, in the amount of {$800.00}. I have independently verified that certain application information matches your name but can not complete my report without your help. '' This is also a violation as per the FDCPA. 

I have not received any validation of such information. I have requested to be provided with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to this debt. I have not receive any. Spotloan also wrote : " Additionally, while you assert we have violated the FDCPA please know that Spotloan is not a debt collector under the FDCPA. Further, we have not owned your loan as of XX/XX/XXXX, we are not affiliated with the XXXX XXXX, and have not attempted to collect on your debt since it was sold to XXXX XXXX " This is another violation of my rights. This is an attempt to collect a debt and as such, Spotloan is liable for this violation under the FDCPA. This office has reported invalidated information to all 3 Major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX  XXXX for five years, which constitute additional fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, the negative marks found on my credit reports by Spotloan and the company that the alleged debt was sold to, is Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. Further, the information that is being reported is also inaccurate per the companies response. Again, this is fraud and violation of the FDCPA. Pursuant to 15 USC 1692c. ( c ) I am demanded that Spotloan cease all forms of communication with me through any and all mediums. Subsequently, I

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In working with Citi cards. They reduced my line of credit down from XXXX to XXXX to the amount that i owed on the account on XXXX of 2020. Then they reported on my credit report that i had maxed out my line of credit. I get it covid and the need to protect their interest. But over the course of the next 11 months i paid on time and tried to pay more than the minimum. On XXXX I paid XXXX down on what i owed on the account and on XXXX they reduced my line of credit down again to the amount that i owed of XXXX. 

Their response was that my reduction was due to my credit score. Well my score stayed flat and even their fico score show only 1 point of movement. Well i ask these questions of citi card 1- If i make another large payment will my line of credit be reduced again ( their response was that they were not sure ) 2- I asked what step i needed to do to help increase my credit score with their company ( their responded was that they do not have any steps or process to improve the score. ) 3 - I asked if i had any late payments or covid paused on the account and they said i has a clean payment record for the past 5 year but they are not sure how this impacts my score.

4 i asked if there was another covid stimulus payment and i applied it to my account what would happen -- they responded that they would love the payment and were not sure if my line of credit would remain the same. 

Long and short citi cards at XXXX are destroying my credit and making it difficult to recover my credit score.

The reason for the large payment was to reduce the amount that i owed and get the maxed out line of credit off of my credit file. I certainly did my part my saving and making my payment on time so this line of acting is damaging to anyone who is trying to recover.

The fact that i am concerned with is that there is a lot of other people that once they are credit line maxed out their credit interest rate also will go up. I have seen other card that i have go up a point or 2 just because of this type of action.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: My wife died. XX/XX/XXXX. Spoke with Wells Fargo estate care center by phone, given case number, instructed to see banker at local branch with death certificate to close account. It took over a month for a banker to return the call. Appointment was made on XX/XX/XXXX for XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX, told to ask for XXXX. Arrived at XXXX XXXX, a bilinqual employee was speaking to someone in XXXX, a XXXX customer tried to get his attention and she spoke to him in a rude manner. He finally acknowledged me and acted like I was an XXXX when I told him that I had an appointment. Says that XXXX isn't there and that they do not close bank accounts for the deceased there and walks off. I call the estate care center again to tell them what is happening and she is just as dumbfounded as I am. She asks if there are other bankers on duty, which I replied that they didn't say. By then a female employee is standing there while I am speaking on the phone, so I ask her if there are other bankers on duty. She says that there are two. The estate care center suggests that I try another branch, the employee overhears this and says that the other branch is not open. I mention that I'm going to file a complaint, then the bank employee says that she would see if a banker would help me. She came back and said that the bankers were with customers, and to give them ten minutes, After 15 minutes, for a total of fifty minutes, I left. A very inconfident, rude and XXXX staff. Been banking there for twenty-five years and I don't even feel comfortable stepping foot in their parking lot again.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to ask for your assistance with an issue that we are having with XXXX  XXXX XXXX through Wells Fargo. 

Our loan is backed by XXXX, but serviced through Wells Fargo. In XXXX we applied for and began a three month forbearance. On the Wells site it indicated that we would be able to delay the three months of payments and add them to the end of our mortgage. The exact thing that we have heard through the news. There was no indication that XXXX loans had different rules. 

After three months of forbearance, we were able to adjust our finances. We asked to resume our payments, and in XXXX began making our normal payments. Online we indicated we wanted to add the payments to the end of the loan. Also, a Wells representative called us and we established that we would be adding the payments to the end of the loan. 

A couple months later, we started getting paperwork and phone calls indicating that XXXX had different rules and would not add the payments to the end of the loan. They indicated we needed to pay the entirety of the three months of payments. This obviously would not be possible for us. 

We received in the mail an appraisal that Wells had ordered for our house. They requested copies of our taxes, pay stubs, and bank statements. Although we did not understand why they needed them, we submitted all requested documents. In XXXX we received even more document requests. We are not sure whether they are proving we make too much, or not enough for whatever they are working on. They insisted multiple times that it was XXXX that wanted the documents. The XXXX representative stated it was not their request. 

In the ten years we have had our mortgage, we have never missed or been late on a payment. On the thirteenth, we will be in " default '' as the documents they are now requesting don't even exist and we won't be able to provide them. Things as silly as they want a " Wet stamp '' rental contract versus the digitally signed contracts we use for our tenants. 

We have requested a copy of the online agreement and phone conversations with Wells representatives, but they have never sent it. 



Thank You, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Last XXXX, we received a notice of cancellation of insurance from XXXX. We called and they inform us that they didn't receive a payment from NewRez. Due to the time constraint, NewRez asked for an overnight address to send the payment before the deadline of XX/XX/2020. After a couple days, we called and we were informed that it was processed. We called and stayed for over 3 hours on the phone, they finally found out that the payment was sent to the wrong place and it was cashed but not applied to our account. We found out that NewRez has been charging Forced Mortgage Insurance since XXXX even though they are the ones all along with XXXX who messed up this whole thing. We called today and paid out of our packet for a home insurance to cover our property. since it will not be resolved quickly. We are baring the loss that we have to pay extra for failure to pay our previous policy ( even though as costumers we were dragged between the two, each one of them is pointing finger at the other ). All XXXX could say is, due to COVID all this happened and no one is assuming responsibility for this deceptive and abusive service ( as described by XXXX XXXX ).

Please accept this letter as my demand for the immediate and complete removal of this tradeline from my credit reports ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I applied for an LL Bean Mastercard. My identity was stolen shortly after I opened the account. During this time, I made a purchase in the amount of {$62.00}. I never received a bill for this purchase. I closed the account shortly after the fraud occurred. 

I did not hear anything from LL Bean Mastercard via phone, email, or mail about a balance due. I believe that LL Bean Mastercard may have had incorrect contact information for me due to the previous fraud that had occurred on the account ( where someone else changed my address, email, and phone number ). 

In XXXX, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that I owed a balance of {$200.00} because of late fees incurred from non-payments on the LL Bean Mastercard. I disputed the fees, explaining that I had never received a bill, and agreed to pay a reduced fee. 

My credit report, however, shows that I made late payments on this account for 7 months and that my account was 90 days past due. I disputed this with XXXX, but they did not change the information on my credit report.

In total, I have been re-charged by a known fraudulent company three times, and have been given misinformation by company representatives on two different occasions. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
US BANK closed my account unexpectedly without any notice or heads up. I had about {$52000.00} in my savings and checking account with them. The manager XXXX handled everything unprofessionally he lied about the account closing saying it was the back office of US BANK when indeed it was him. 

I asked him how will I get my money back he said he sent out a cashiers check to me. After 2-3 weeks waiting for a cashiers check that shouldve been over night mail. I contacted XXXX at US BANK asking him where the checks are and why its taking so long. According to him since he had the tracking number he said they havent been mailed out yet and still at the post office. I then asked for him to cancel those checks and i can come by the branch he said that wasnt possible. 
It was 2 checks that where supposed to get sent to me via USPS and signed for. I have cameras all over my house and can assure you that not one single person from the post office brought me anything all year let alone that week to sign for checks. My checks either never got sent to me and got cashed by someone else at the branch or they got delivered or stolen from a different address. Cause the checks got cashed at a XXXX XXXX. I dont bank with XXXX and had identity theft involving chase last year which i can provide a police report and FTC reports to show proof. 

Another week goes by and i still dont have my money. I called XXXX back and he said he needs to get an OK from higher management to see when he can reissue me my checks. After a couple hours he called back and all of a sudden says how the checks where cashed and try asking me if i forgot i cashed 2 checks around {$52000.00} like Id forget something like that. Pretty much he was accusing me for cashing Checks. He then had me come to the branch to file some fraud forms that he didnt help me with and let me know what has to be filled out which delayed the process even more. After another month of miscommunication my forms and fraud case where approved by US BANK fraud department. They finally found out where my checks where cashed and sent 3 letters to that bank demanding the funds back so i can finally get my money back. But the process has been taking way too long and i really need those funds. Its been 6 months already and i still havent seen a dime from my money yet.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2020, I got an email about my JCPenney credit card statements. It said that starting the first of XXXX, I wasn't getting paper statements any more. They had changed my statements to electronic only, and if I wanted to change it back to a paper statement, I needed to click a link in the email. I don't EVER click links in unsolicited emails, and I've had many fraudulent emails from ppl claiming to be from a bank or company that I use. I ignored it, because when I XXXX  if it was legal for a company to do that, I found it was NOT legal. Then I got ANOTHER email from a different store credit card through Synchrony saying the same thing. I don't usually check my email more than once a month, unless I'm looking for tracking info on a package I'm expecting. I called the company, and told them it was illegal for them to be changing my billing without notifying me BY MAIL. As far as I know, it was changed back, but I've now gotten an email about a card in my wife 's name with the same garbage tactic. I believe it's to make millions in late fees by changing billing and hoping lots of people like me won't see the email or won't respond. They also refused to put ANY of my payment amount towards an " 18 months no interest '' promotion, so I'm going to get hit with hundreds of dollars in back interest in the fall. They also suddenly lowered credit limits on two accounts to just over what my balance was, which caused a 60 point drop in my credit score. There were NO late payments, missed payments, or anything else. ALL of my credit cards have been in good standing. This company is corrupt, is doing illegal things and is destroying people 's credit in the middle of a historic pandemic. 
Their business practices are designed to cause harm to consumers and attempting to use fraud to make money from late fees, over the limit fees, and raising interest rates as punishment for the results of what THEY are creating.

I called Wells Fargo to resolve a complaint about interest charges due to an issue of Wells Fargo not debiting my account for the credit card fees. Wells Fargo fixed that issue and offered to set up automatic payments for my credit card so this issue would not arise again. I agreed. 
six months later while reviewing my bills I realised that I was being charged monthly interest. On contacting wells Fargo they told me they automatic payments have been set up for the minimum amount due and not the full amount. when setting up the automatic payment, I was not provided with this information.

I have requested Wells Fargo to refund the interest charged for the seven months as the minimum payment was set up without my authorization either by mistake by wells Fargo or maybe intentionally to earn unnecessary interest. 
It should be noted that there is no easy way for setting up automatic payment online at the Wells Fargo site, nor is the information that only minimum payments are being chrged clearly shown on the online credit card statement. 
It was only when I downloaded the PDF statements was I able to see and understand what was happening.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
It started with myself looking at my finances as a whole. I called the credit card company and found out that there was a promotional balance transfer offer - and I took it. I transfered my balance from another card to this new card. I'd like to note the reasoning behind this action : My goal was to show a lower credit card utilization percentage. The card I transferred from was almost 100 % and the card I was transferring to had such a high credit limit ( mind you, I haven't use this card in a while! ) so after I transfer to this new card, the utilization percentage would be roughly around 50 % and the prior card would now be at 0 % - this action would improve my credit score as I continue to pay off my debt. 

About 1-2 weeks later I received an email saying that my credit limit decreased after a review of my credit reporting. ( attached ) This was alarming so I called the credit card company to try and rectify this. I was pretty upset of course because this now defeated the purpose of me transfering my money to this new credit card banking company. My question was - why, after I recently transfer money does the company want to 'review my account ' and lower my limit. If my credit reporting history has been the same for a while now, then why didn't they want to lower it beforehand. Also - why would they approve the balance transfer offer to me? 

I don't find this action professional from this company at all. 

When I spoke to the representative over the phone, I was able to get transferred to a supervisor ( they told me this person was anyways ) and they put a request in to 'raise my credit limit '. I didn't think this was the correct procedure to do honestly. I new it would go through as a normal request - not a special case request as my phone call into them was pertaining to. I feel this was on a whole different level where it should have been handled differently. So of course, I received a denial letter ( attached ). 

I don't feel this was right or handled properly. This action did worse to my credit report. I honestly wish I just never did the transfer. I am looking into any options that I have to get this rectified. The very least, I want to pull my money back out from them and move it to another credit card banking company. They do not deserve my money for what took place.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage is with Suntrust/Truist. In XXXX of last year, I requested forbearance and it was granted for six months ( email confirmation received XX/XX/XXXX ). After a couple of months, my father offered to pay for a bit to help me not incur penalties at the end. I mention this because the payments during the first six months were intentional. 

Suntrust/Truist called me in early XXXX and asked if I wanted to extend the forbearance ; at that time I hadn't made a decision and would call them back. Later that month, I called, requested, and was granted an extension of three months ( XXXX ) and received a confirmation email on XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX, I called and requested the final three months ( XXXX ) and received a confirmation email on XX/XX/XXXX. 

When recently reviewing my bank statements preparing for taxes, I suddenly realized that Suntrust/Truist had reinstated payments in XXXX and had been drawing payments since the end of the first six months, even though my forbearance was extended ( {$2300.00} for XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). Today XXXX spent close to THREE hours on hold or talking to a total of SIX different representatives, the first five who said they weren't the right department and the sixth said I had called them in XXXX and asked them to reinstate payments ( not true ). When I told her that wasn't true, explained the fallacy in that statement ( why would I reinstate automatic payments when I was requesting forbearance?! ) and asked her to prove it with the recorded phone call audio ( since they record all calls ), she put me on hold for another 15 minutes and then hung up on me.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened the Synchrony Bank PayPal MasterCard summer of XXXX and set up autopay for minimum balance in XX/XX/XXXX. I have paid off the card in full nearly every month and never missed a payment. 


I checked my card today XX/XX/XXXX and was surprised to see an automatic payment for {$740.00} considering I manually paid {$200.00} XX/XX/XXXX and my minimum payment was more than covered. 


I checked my email - my last autopay change email was in XX/XX/XXXX when I set up the autopay initially, or so I thought. 


In my spam folder, marked as a phishing/spam email, I had received two notifications indicating my autopay had been changed to " statement balance '', and to call a new number if I did not authorize this change. As I never saw the email, I did not get the opportunity to change this - I never received mail or other notification indicating this change. 


When I called Synchrony, they were unable to help me and transferred me to a PayPal number that did not deal with the PayPal Mastercard. I called again about an hour later after attempting to have an ACH stop put on my checking account.

Synchrony said that in 2-3 weeks, I would receive a check for the {$740.00} payment I did not authorize ... they gave no information about what this meant for my credit card payment. Obviously I can't pay my bill if the entire balance of my checking account is floating in the aether for 2-3 weeks. They were unable to give me email or written confirmation that this check would be sent. On the phone they also " upgraded '' my card to a new account with a different account number. I no longer have access to my payment or charge history beyond screenshots I've taken during this entire process. 


I did not consent to the automatic payment of {$740.00}, and now I have to wait nearly a month for the privilege of maybe receiving a check for this amount.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX I went to the AmeriSave site to check their interest rates. The site requires that you enter basic information to to proceed ( Name, phone number and email address ). One of the screens specifically states that they will not do a hard pull to your credit and it will not affect your score. This was important to me because I am still several months away from purchasing. There was a section that has disclosures that I clicked through but did not read through all of them. I am assuming that these disclosures had a statement that they were going to do a hard pull to my credit because I received a notice from my credit service that stated that a hard pull was done. I then received a call from a rep from AmeriSave who confirmed that they did a hard pull. Since they boldly and specifically stated that they were not doing a hard pull and I did not provide my date of birth or social security number, I had no expectation that my credit was being pulled. I believe they intentionally deceive clients into moving forward in the process by burrying the credit authorization and making them believe that their credit isn't being pulled because many people, like me, would stop the process if I was aware that my credit was being pulled.
