Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo is applying our excess payments to the next month 's mortgage payment instead of paying down principle. This practice ensures they receive the interest and escrow payments, and shorts my attempt to pay the mortgage off early. 

I've contacted them repeatedly by email and phone, to request all additional funds to be applied to my outstanding principle. Looking at our account history online, it is very difficult to determine how funds were applied following Wells Fargo 's numerous corrections. 

I do not have a record of all communications, but my last interaction was messaging via the Wells Fargo website on XX/XX/2020. I was assured the problems were permanently corrected. However, looking at the transaction history for my XX/XX/2020 payment, there are three entries, this is how the funds were applied ... again : Amount Submitted : {$4400.00} Actual Monthly Mortgage Pmt : XXXX Amount to be applied to outstanding principle : XXXX Actual distribution : Principle ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : {$1000.00} Interest ( XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX Escrow ( XX/XX/XXXX ). XXXX Principle ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX Interest ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX Escrow ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX Outstanding principle : XXXX Expected Principle Reduction : {$3200.00} Actual Principle Reduction : XXXX Difference : XXXX We prioritize paying off our greatest debt early in order to free up that money for retirement, and we have been diligent in doing so. Wells Fargo 's misapplication of the funds ensures their revenue stream at our expense. Effectively they are penalizing us for early repayment. 

I will submit a copy of my most recent communication if needed.

( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), California Financial Code sections 4002 and 22470, Civil Code section 1748.95 and Penal Code 530.8. Also included in the three letters I had provided the following : FTC Cover letter, FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of my identity, FTC Notice to Furnishers of Information, XXXX  Victim release form titled Identity Theft Victims Request for Fraudulent Transaction/Account Information ( Form A ), XXXX XXXX Sheriff Incident Report, and a separate document ( Attachment A ), detailing requested information on the fraudulent account. 
After 30 days, Citi Cards CBNA had only sent statements dating back to XXXX of XXXX but no documents dating back to XX/XX/XXXX or anything with my signature. On XX/XX/XXXX the Citi Bank representative informs me that Citi Bank CBNA can not give me the signed application. Citi Bank Services refuses to comply with the request for information that I am lawfully in my right to request.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, at approximately XXXX XXXX eastern time, I called trust mark national bank based in Mississippi. I ask for mortgage forbearance due to financial hardship amidst COVID 19. I was immediately interrogated as to why I couldn't pay the loan. I explained that because of the Coronavirus, Aid, Relief and Economic Security Act ( CARES Act ) this allowed employers to defer the deposit and payment of the employer 's share of Social Security taxes. My pay had been significantly decreased. I also explained that my significant other had lost her job, leaving me to pay all the bills. The trust mark employee, XXXX XXXX, put me on hold. She returned and stated she would send me paperwork for loss mitigation. I asked if this loss mitigation was in regards to COVID financial hardship. She stated no and that it was something they did for individuals who had issues paying their mortgage. I stated I needed the help and could pay in about two months, but couldn't pay now. I asked if I filled out the paperwork and the results from the Trustmark on the loss mitigation paperwork didn't come back in time for payment would it be reported to the credit bureau? She stated it would most definitely be reported to the Credit bureau. I stated please send me the paperwork. I went home and did the necessary research to ensure that I qualified for the financial hardship mortgage relief act. It stated that VA backed loans qualified in reference to the CARES ACT. I called the Trustmark back and XXXX XXXX answered the phone again. I calmly explained that maybe I did not explain my situation properly. I gave her the details and the CARES act information. She stated I didn't qualify. I asked to speak with a supervisor, she stated he was on the phone. I told her I would wait until he got off. She hung up on me and sent me to his voicemail. During these troubling times I am taking care of two kids and my significant other. This is the last type of service that I thought I would receive after fighting for my country. I am absolutely appalled at how I was treated and would like to helped.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Citibank is engaging in unlawful, deceptive, & misleading business practices in violation of federal statute New York GBL 349. Citibank markets a Paycheck Protection Program ( PPP ) on a national level. Citibank provides business owners with a list of the required documentation necessary to apply for a PPP loan. Businesses rely on the provided list and submit the required documents. Despite submitting all of the required documentation, Citibank conveniently advises their business clients that they are unable to verify payroll and categorically deny the applications. At the time that businesses contact Citibank by telephone, they are informed that a telephone number for the PPP Department does not exist and that all inquiries should be sent by email. As opposed to its competitor national banks such as XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX which both have dedicated PPP Department customer service representatives assisting business clients with PPP applications, Citibank makes it impossible to receive the assistance that businesses not only desperately need to financially survive but also deserve as loyal business clients. Afterall, PPP applications must be submitted to the bank where businesses have accounts. When businesses send emails to the provided email, they receive generic emails which cause immense confusion, aggravation, and unnecessary delays. This is because the email responses do not clarify what, if anything, is missing from files in order to obtain approval. By way of limited example, email responses provide information regarding loan forgiveness which is irrelevant because a PPP loan has not yet even been approved, thus making forgiveness options irrelevant. On another example, email responses provide a telephone number, but the provided phone number is for general Citibank inquiries and the representatives advise that they have no information regarding PPP loans. Yet, on another example, email responses advise businesses to reapply. However, upon re-applying and again submitting all of the required documentation specifically following the required documentation list provided by Citibank, businesses once again receive emails stating, unable to verify payroll. Citibank fails to advise business clients as to the exact resolution measures. Citibanks unlawful, deceptive, & misleading business practices cause tremendous financial issues for businesses attempting their very best to survive during these uncertain times. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate Citibanks unlawful business practices and implement penalties accordingly. Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This involves a construction mortgage loan which was with Trustmark National Bank. Trustmark 's mortgage division denied a previously approved 30 year locked in rate ( see exhibit F ) for the permanent financing for this construction loan. The underwriting was behind schedule because they were all working from home during the height of the pandemic. This caused a delay in underwriting, so the denial occurred two months after the maturity of the construction loan. The reason for denial as stated by the Trustmark mortgage division ( see exhibit G ), was that they perceived that there was a forbearance on my credit from another loan ( different bank ) because the credit report showed a footnote that said " affected by national declared emergency '', even though the report reflected all debts as current. Trustmark bank, who held the construction note, then agreed to provide accommodations by modifying the loan, lowering the rate, deferring the current payment that had matured, and amortizing it for 240 payments. The span of time between when the construction loan matured, and when the underwriting for both the mortgage division, and the bank itself was complete was approximately 90 days. For this time period, the bank charged interest for the time value of the balance, but at the same time it reported the note as delinquent ( see exhibit H ). 
In Summary, My complaints are against Both Trustmark National Bank and Trustmark Mortgage for the following reasons : 1. Trustmark National Bank provided accommodations as defined in Section 4021 of the CARES Act, while being aware of, and in full knowledge that this issue was directly affected by COVID 19. 
2. Trustmark bank violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act as well as Section 4021 of the CARES Act in reporting the covid related accommodations as delinquent.

3. The illegal/erroneous reports by Trustmark National Bank, has caused financial harm to me.

4. Both the loan officer, and branch president have been notified in writing of the incorrect reporting, but as to date, they either refuse to respond to the email, or otherwise have failed to respond. When confronted in person, the branch president stated his position to be that he had made no errors and would make no corrections. 

I have made every effort to pursue this through the channels available to me, such as filing disputes with the bank and various agencies including the credit reporting bureau experian. Now as there have been no corrections, I will pursue litigation if this avenue is not successful.

Thanks for Your Help In This Matter

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: My husband and I were exposed to XXXX and were were forced to quarantine for 14 days in XXXX of XXXX, and then actually did get XXXX in XXXX of XXXX. We applied for mortgage forbearance in XX/XX/XXXX through the Cares Act and were approved for 60 days. When we were out of the forbearance period, I applied for reinstatement of normal mortgage payments with the two missed payments to be attached to the end of the loan. We have significant equity in our home that we have lived in for almost 8 years, and my husband and I both have excellent credit, so there was no reason this should not have been approved. The mortgage company, Lakeview Loan Servicing, instead created an entirely new loan for us with the same interest rate, but of course a new amortization schedule, which will cost us XXXX  of dollars in the long-run due to more of our payments going to interest versus principal for the next several years. The customer service rep I spoke to said that this is the only option for VA loans. This is ridiculous and was never explained to us when we applied for forbearance. This is a very sad situation that this mortgage company would treat military veterans this way, and the worst part is that most people would not realize the financial impact the new amortization schedule has and would have no idea that this was a bad thing. In my opinion, this is an unfair business practice and the company should be investigated as such.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
As a XXXX XXXX XXXX for 36 years, I am writing to report what I feel are unfair and deceptive acts or practices made by both U.S. Bank. 
I recently received notification from the banks referenced above that my credit line has been lowered due the reasons listed below : Proportion of balances to credit limits is too high on bank revolving or other revolving accounts Lack of recent installment loan information Amount owed on revolving accounts is too high Time since most recent account opening is too short This deceptive practice is balance chasing which means that instead of freeing up credit, the customer has less available credit due to the lower credit limit. The banks are beginning to engage in this practice to limit their risk by reducing the amount of a particular borrowers available credit.

Balance chasing is more likely to occur if the cardholder makes larger payments or may appear to be a high-risk borrower who makes late payments or defaults on other credit cards or loans. An unintended consequence of balance chasing is that even though debt repayment is responsible consumer behavior, it can make it difficult improve a credit score, such a FICO score. 
Another issue with this is that my credit utilization has increased since the banks reduced my credit line. It has also impacted my credit score making it much more difficult to be approved for credit so that I may consolidate my debt as I have done in the past. It is just a matter of time before I see a rate hike due to this unfair practice. 
My credit history has been solid, so it is not clear to me as to why there is a lack of recent installment loan information seeing that I had two automobile loans from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and was paid in full on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, respectively. 
Please note that as of XX/XX/XXXX my credit score was XXXX and is currently reporting at XXXX as of XX/XX/XXXX. I have always made my payments in a timely manner and my credit has remained in good standing for many years despite what is stated above. 
The average age of my accounts is 7 years and 5 months with the oldest account 17 years and 6 months. 
My newest account was opened recently at a furniture store back on XX/XX/XXXX. I also had two personal loans I took out with XXXX XXXX that were paid in full as of XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
I understand that the economic conditions have worsened due to the COVID-19 pandemic and that may be a reason for banks showing their reluctance to lend. However, consumers that reflect a solid credit history with favorable credit scores should not be penalized. This appears to be another tactic to raise their interest rates and bottom line.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2021, I received an escrow shortage notice from MyLoanCare which services my mortgage account. The mortgage escrow shortage was for {$1300.00} ( roughly ). I paid the amount via personal check and returned the escrow shortage slip as instructed. The payment took almost three weeks to be received. Moreover when it was received it was NOT applied as an escrow shortage but instead as a regular monthly installment. I called my mortgage serviced and they apologized and advised they would reverse the payment and apply it correctly. The representative confirmed it was an oversight in his end. Today, I look at my account again and they payment had been reversed and applied to escrow ; nonetheless the monthly installment still shows my shortage as not paid and the payment continues to show the amount that would have been due if it was not paid. This is unfair and unethical. They tell you to pay one amount and take your money ; however its sitting in limbo and not applied as advised. This is a UDAAP violation. They are collecting and keeping my funds! They need to take that amount and apply it as they advised they would. My payment should not be {$1200.00} but instead {$1100.00} as promised in the statement.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Army Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ) refuses to stop reporting a derogatory item against my personal credit report despite presentation of documentation that proves the existence of mitigating circumstances tied to active duty military service. After I was ordered to active duty from the reserve component, an automatic allotment that I had setup to make automatic payments against my open XXXX XXXX XXXX ( credit card offered and managed by AAFES ) did not immediately carry over. I was ordered to attend an intense military training pipeline that spanned approximately 20 months and included multiple short-notice relocations during that timeframe ( see attached sets of orders ). Additionally, the Creditor is in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act because I was never provided prior notification of pending material changes to my credit report. It was only after reaching my final base that I learned something was wrong. One of my paychecks was approximately XXXX smaller than normal. Upon reconciliation of the reserve and active pay systems, the XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) automatically sent a single payment to close the remaining outstanding balance still open against the account held by the named Creditor ( reference the attached Leave and Earnings Statement ). In effect, by the time I realized something was wrong, the Creditor had already sent the account into collections. The Creditor claims to have sent notification ; however, the last address they had on file was my reserve unit HQ building -- even though this makes no sense as the XXXX XXXX is a personal credit card requiring a residential address during the application/sign up process ( which I provided ). Personnel at my reserve unit were not able to verify receipt of any personal notifications addressed to me from AAFES during my absence. 

I have attempted to work directly with the Creditor and all three Credit Reporting Agencies XXXX see attached email correspondence and dispute letters XXXX. I have even retained legal representation ( see attached legal notices from XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The Creditor states that the decision rests with the CRAs. The CRAs state that the decision rests with the Creditor. All involved parties refuse to coordinate and simply shift the responsibility. I have already filed a complaint against the CRAs, but was unable to also list AAFES. This complaint is specifically intended for the named Creditor.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have attempted to reach Pro Collect on numerous occasions regarding this debt that I allegedly owe. I never had an account with the original creditor and have also received no response from them when asked to show documentation or a signed contract. I know that I have no signed contract with Pro Collect nor did I authorize them to open an account in my name. It is illegal to add unverified and/or inaccurate information to a persons credit profile. With that said I am demanding that Pro Collect provide original signed contracts that prove they are attempting to collect a debt from the correct person, proof that they are a licensed debt collector in the state in which they are attempting to collect from along with their license number AND proof that they have the legal authority to represent the original creditor in legal matters. 

If these things can not be provided I will be handing this over to my attorneys and seeking any and all remuneration under the law as this entry on my credit report is unlawful and has damaged my credit rating.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX a 30 day late payment was reported on my Transunion credit report on a loan with the company XXXX XXXX. This was not accurate and I opened a dispute with Transunion and provided documentation that showed the payment was not 30 days late as reported and requesting it to be removed. Approximately 30 days later I received an email stating that the investigation had been completed and as a result the late payment was removed from my report. I checked my report and confirmed it had been removed as stated. Four days later on XX/XX/XXXX I received a credit monitoring alert stating that a 30 day late had been reported. When I checked my Transunion report, the same 30 day late that had been removed on XX/XX/XXXX had returned. I called Transunion and was told that while their investigation did in fact remove the late payment, it was re-added on the next monthly update from the lender. I asked for it to be removed again as it had just been investigated and found to be invalid just a week earlier and was told that Transunion can't remove items from my credit report. I questioned that since they had just removed it 4 days earlier and I was again refused and told I would need to open another dispute to have it investigated. Transunion has told me that I will have to open a new investigation literally every month going forward to have this removed each time individually. This is ridiculous. I opened the dispute, Transunion performed their investigation and determined the report to be invalid and they removed it. Now 4 days later it's back and they are telling me they can't remove it or block it from recurring. I am asking for the CFPB 's support in getting Transunion to remove and permanently block this reporting as it was already determined invalid by their own investigation.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of 2017, I opened a checking account with Bank of America. In XXXX of 2017, I deposited a check into the account that ended up being drawn on an account that had just been closed, although I did not know it. My account was immediately frozen. I called customer service, and they told me what had happened and suggested that I go speak to the manager of the bank branch where I had opened the account, who should be able to lift the freeze. 

When I went to the bank to see the manager, I was accompanied by my XXXX  granddaughters, who are XXXX. The manager stared at them, and it was obvious to me that because he was white, he was making a XXXX judgment on me ( I'm also white ) for having XXXX grandchildren. He was very rude to me and told me that because the deposit I made was returned, it caused several checks I had written to bounce. Although the account was not overdrawn, because I had bounced a check in the first 30 days, he said that bank had to close my account. The manager returned to me the money that was still in the account, and closed it during my visit. He assured me that there would be no negative reporting ramifications from the closure, as it was not my fault. 

Recently, I attempted to open an account with a different bank and was denied. I obtained a copy of my XXXX  Report ( as recommended by the denying bank ) to see why I had been denied, and I noted that Bank of America had reported me to XXXX in 2017, indicating they had closed my account due to " suspected fraud ''. This is completely inaccurate. The XXXX report also indicated that I had an unpaid amount owed to BofA as a result of the closed account, which is also inaccurate. 

I contacted BofA several times to request that they remove the false information from XXXX, but the customer service reps I spoke with said they were unable to do so, but could not provide me any valid reason why ( as they agreed with me as to why my account had been closed and confirmed I did not owe BofA any money ). 

The false and negative report by Bank of America to XXXX is preventing me from opening any bank accounts, which I need to do for my small business. I am being harmed severely every day that the false information remains on the report.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX  ; XXXX  and Transunion should not be reporting each inquiry listed as a separate line item on my credit report for XXXX and XXXX. These multiple inquiries in are well within the shopping window that is typically allowed to check different lenders and find the best loans. Each one of these inquiries listed are of like kind. They are not separate, individual entities. These inquiries should not have negatively impacted my credit score and they need to be removed from my credit report. ( Please see pages attached from my credit report. ) This false reporting of multiple inquiries is seriously harming my credit score. Please update to report only one line item for each. It is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act to not report accurate information on my credit report. I have contacted the bureaus to fix this however, I have not been successful.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted Transunion on 3 occasion about fraudulent information being housed on my credit reports ; I mailed them a copy of a police report and they still have refused to remove fraud inquiries on my report. They are violating my consumer rights by still reporting this information as true.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: Shellpoint mortgage ran an escrow analysis, but failed to recognize that we are paying for flood insurance on our own. I sent them proof of coverage. In addition, their process to have the coverage removed is very time consuming and difficult to reach the correct departments.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: We had a home equity loan with XXXX, with Nationstar being the servicer. We went on a forebearance plan in XX/XX/XXXX due to Covid and losing income because of it. We renewed it every 3 months with it supposed to be ending in XX/XX/XXXX. Our hope was to defer the payments we missed after it ended in XXXX and start fresh. We received a letter from Nationstar that said as of XX/XX/XXXX our new servicer would be XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and all payments should be directed to them after XX/XX/XXXX. I called Nationstar and talked to a rep and asked why this happened and they said it just does and nothing has changed except they would be who you make payments to after the forebearance ends. Then on XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter that they are actually a debt collector and I had to do a loan modification with them to pay back the entire home equity loan. This is being reported as our loan went to a collection agency and is a bad mark on our credit report. It was not our fault that this happened snd we were never told it was being sent to a collection agency. We want this off our credit report. Nationstar totally missed that the loan was in forebearance and under the cares act we should have been protected, not sent to collections!

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I file for chapter XXXX bankruptcy on XX/XX/XXXX and I get the order of discharge on XX/XX/XXXX, which include all my credit cards with the exception of my car loan which I continue to pay my monthly installment until I pay off the whole balance of {$4400.00} on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, but when I checked my credit report recently from the three major credit bureaus I was surprised that the ( pay status ) of my auto loan which represented by ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) is included in my bankruptcy case which is not supposed to be, I contacted XXXX, XXXX and Experian and ask them to correct the wrong information about my auto loan and I send them all the required documents, each of them launched their own investigation, after all the result come back with no change and they stated that the car loan is part of the bankruptcy.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The account in Question is with XXXX XXXX. The payment was delinquent and was eventually charged off. The problem is the XXXX XXXX is refusing to update the dates correctly. This account should have been removed from my credit reports in XXXX of this year, however now it is has once again continued to stay on my report and XXXX XXXX nor the 3 Credit Bureaus will correct the dates and remove this information as they should according to the FCRA and Federal Law. 

The date of first delinquency on this account was XXXX, XXXX. This means that according to the FCRA and Federal Law this account should have been removed. I am not sure what sort of games XXXX XXXX is playing but every time I call to speak with a rep, no one will work with me. I have contacted and disputed this information with all 3 credit reporting agencies and they continue to report the innacurate information. According to XXXX XXXX, Experian, XXXX and XXXX now the date of first delinquency is XX/XX/XXXX. This means that this will now be on my reports for another year or more. 

I have tried every other means to correct this issue with all parties involved and no one will listen or cares enough to actually investigate as they should to see that this information has continued to change year after year. 

It is extremely frustrating that these company 's are allowed to do this to the average consumer like myself and hurt our chances of improving our positions in life. I am not excusing the fact that I allowed this account to go delinquent and then be charged off but this was over 7 and half years ago and I am doing everything in my power to do the right things. 

You can't keep changing the finish line because you want to harm consumers, it isn't right nor legal.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative: My available credit keeps going down because they are double charging me. I've contacted them two days in a row and asked them to fix it and they just keep saying it's updating.

Product: Student loan
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of XXXX I was contacted by Pioneer Credit Recovery stating that held a student loan in my name but it was in default. They stated that they were handling my account that previously been held by the US department of Education and that the remaining balance was close to {$15000.00}. Within 30 days, without prior notification, nor an opportunity to dispute began garnishing my wages. First and foremost, the biggest issue that I had then and even more now is th reviewing my data report recently at XXXX The Work Numbers website I was able to see that the organization that requested information about my employment information was Sallie Mae, in XXXX of XXXX. I have never had a student loan with Salie Mae or any one else!! I completed my education and received my diploma from XXXX XXXX University in XXXX. Upon requesting documents to support their claim I was sent multiple copies of the same bogus forged and falsified documents that I have never heard of nor seen prior to that day! After requesting any other documentation to support the debt owed, In a nutshell they do not!! Also, I Sallie Mae was never mentioned. Pioneer Credit Recovery Inc seems to believe without doubt that, the debt is legitimate debt. They dont have any official documents to prove that the debt belongs to me They havent proven anything whatsoever but feel that they are within the guidelines of the law!!! Its it is bogus fraudulent Unauthorized documents that someone has falsely obtained and presented as legit.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: We have had mortgages for condos before and we have NEVER had the problems that we are having with this new loan through Suntrust/Truist Bank. I keep getting letters that they are going to purchase insurance for for us unless we submit proof of insurance. I do that and they send me another and another with dire warnings. First it is for unit and flood because there was some sort of mix up and they didn't get info at closing, ok. The next was for condominium master policy which is paid by the association and covered through our HOA dues. They want us to submit proof every year that the association has insurance or they will purchase a policy for us so that we would be double paying. What? Now they are telling us even though XXXX sends them the bill every year, we have to contact Suntrust and tell them that we are renewing with XXXX for flood and wall to wall or they will automatically purchase their preferred insurance for us. In essence, we have to contact them XXXX times over the course of a 30 yr loan. They can not put it in their system to automatically pay XXXX every year unless we tell them otherwise. This is a scam.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: Had a unexpected charge hit my account for XXXX while overdrew my account {$1.00} and was pending. I transferred money into the account that evening when I checked my account. Again while the XXXX charge was still pending. But they didnt post my transfer till the next date.. again even though it was pending still when money transferred. Then the charged me a overdraft fee of {$35.00} for the {$1.00} overdraft even though the funds were transferred prior to posting.then as a result of the {$35.00} charge a small charge the next day hit of about XXXX and they charged another {$35.00} fee. The next day charge would not have overdraft XXXX if they had not charged the previous {$35.00} fee. Thus they cost me {$70.00} in fees for a {$1.00} overdraft that was corrected prior to posting. When contacted they just said the transfer wasnt dont till the next day, which is not true. It was done while the XXXX charge was still pending and not processed.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: My fiance and I went to XXXX XXXX car dealership in XXXX, Florida to trade in her vehicle for a new one. We were {$9000.00} upside down in the vehicle. They told us no problem. We told them to run our credit report once. We did not want them repeatedly running our credit. She found her dream car, a XXXX XXXX XXXX. I offered them {$500.00} down they told me to save it, it would only lower the payment by {$20.00} or {$30.00}. We took the car home that Monday night. The next morning she got alerts on her phone that her credit was still being inquired. I went to the dealership and asked the XXXX XXXX about it and he told me, after looking on the computer that we had two approvals and the deal is done. Fast Forward to Friday, we called the dealership about the remote start and they told us the XXXX needed to speak to us. He said, they were requiring {$2500.00} down to close the deal. We went back and we negotiated a {$1000.00} down payment with cash due in 30 days. They day before I was about to give them the first portion of the down payment they told us there was no deal and wanted the car back. Not only was my fiance crushed, we were now two months behind on the other car payment and our credit scores had gone down over XXXX points because they repeatedly ran the deal to 20 different primary and secondary lenders without our permission after assuring us we had two approvals and the deal was done.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I've been disputing fraud accounts on my credit report since XX/XX/2020. I keep sending multiple sets of letters to the bureaus so the excuse of " we didn't get it '' doesn't happen. Furthermore, each letter is certified mail with tracking and each letter shows signed and delivered and yet the bureaus are still not taking any actions. The accounts are not showing in dispute nor are they removed from my report. I have requested the investigation to be initiated and also verifiable proof to be submitted should the account claim to be mine. Not only have I not received any mail showing the verifiable proofs needed to justify the accounts to be on my report, I haven't even received any letters at all stating the investigations have begun. Per the FCRA and federal law, the process is supposed to be 30 days. 250 days later, I'm still here shelling out money for certified mail with no end in sight and no results to show. This is my last option before I take this up with my lawyers and sue for full compensations and damages incurred.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account XXXX ... XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I have been a long time credit card customer of XXXX. They don't care one bit about the fees they charge. I contacted them because I paid off my credit card all but apprx XXXX. I paid them {$4500.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, they want to charge me {$68.00} in interest? 

This what they said " Any time your statement balance is not paid in full by the due date, youre assessed interest on the average daily balance. Your previous statement balance was {$4600.00} and we received payments totaling {$4500.00}, thus causing interest to bill to the account. '' Okay, I understand that interest would be charged on the balance, but {$68.00}??? 
This is pure robbery and their way of making BIG time $ $ off of consumers. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, where the balance was {$4500.00}, they charged me {$79.00} in interest which is understandable, but I make a large payment BEFORE the interest is posted and they still want to charge me {$68.00}? I would like to have this interest fee either removed or reduced drastically. 
This is the problem with credit cards ; they don't even allow you to pay off any debt, because they double your monthly payments all because of the interest they charge. It's strictly a game and what's even worse, I have a credit score of XXXX. 
Your assistance on this would be greatly appreciated.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a statement in XXXX from Sears Mastercard. I noticed that I had been charged late fees and interest charges on that statement. I always pay my statement seven days in advance of the due date and have never had a problem being charged late fees and interest charges. I immediately called customer service and asked them why they were charging me late fees and interest charges. Sears customer services stated they had received the payment late. It was determined in this conversation that the mail either had been held up or the payment had not been processed in a timely matter at the Sears Office. Customer Service said they would waive the charges. While talking with Customer Service, I pulled XXXX statement and noted that Sears had also charged a late fee and interest charge for that month. Customer Service stated that they had not received my payment in time for that month. Customer Service waived the late fee and interest charge for that month. I had to call back the next day to have those fees waived as Customer Service stated that could not waive fees for two consecutive months in one call. 

I received my XXXX Statement on XX/XX/2021 and it indicates that Sears is charging {$7.00} interest for purchases. I called Sears and talked with XXXX at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2021. I questioned why I was being charged an interest charge for purchases. I asked that this charge be waived and explained the circumstances with prior Customer Service calls. She stated that it is their policy that no additional waivers can take place after the two waivers for the prior months. This was not discussed with me by the prior Customer Services Representatives that did the initial waivers. 

I am disputing this charge because I have been faithful in making my payments on time for many years that I have held a Sears Credit Card. These late fees and interest charges were not due to my error but due to the lag in postal service, COVID pandemic and the lack of personnel to process payments issued to Sears Mastercard.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2021, I checked my Available Balance in my Bank of America checking account - using the Bank of America mobile and web apps - at approximately XXXX PT. I confirmed that there were sufficient funds to cover an impending withdrawal of {$2400.00} from a check sent to my landlord. 

I later confirmed that the {$2400.00} in funds was withdrawn successfully from my account, with plenty of available funds, leaving {$290.00}. This is still documented on my account, as documented in the attached screenshot of the mobile app. 

The following morning, despite more than {$4100.00} being deposited into the account, I learned that the check was " returned '' and an overdraft fee of {$35.00} was charged. 

After speaking with several representatives at the bank, XXXX ( XXXX ) confirmed that the bank erred in several important ways, and is clearly misleading customers about their available balances. XXXX confirmed that she would file an internal complaint on the following issues, and I stated that I would do the same. 

These issues are : Mobile and web apps - The bank 's own apps are providing incorrect and misleading Account Balances. The bank claims that, only on the web app, there is a separate area of the app that shows which checks have " posted '' and therefore, what the actual account balance is. This is incredibly misleading to average consumers, such as myself. I have been a customer of this bank for more than a decade, and this has never happened before. I have attached a screenshot which confirms that {$290.00} was remaining in the account after the check was withdrawn, proving that the check should not have been returned. 

Overdraft Fee - I was told that the Overdraft Fee can not be returned to me while " processing. '' XXXX confirmed that this is incorrect and she returned it to me. 

Overdraft Protection -My Overdraft Protection was linked to a closed savings account, yet I was not told this, so the checking account did not pull from the correct account when it needed to. XXXX confirmed that this is incorrect and misleading. 

Notification - I was not notified in a timely manner about the overdraft. XXXX confirmed that this needs to be corrected.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an issue that requires your offices attention. Im a premier client and have maintained a 25+ year relationship with Bank of America . I recently refinanced my existing JUMBO home 1st mortgage with Bank of America and also maintain a HELOC with BofA. During the refinancing process ( for the mortgage ) I requested a modest increase to my unused HELOC ( figuring it would be easier to get it all done at once ). I was told by my mortgage banker ( XXXX XXXX XXXX NMLS # XXXX ) that it would be easier to increase the HELOC after we closed the first mortgage. Now I am being told ( post closing of refinancing ) that an increase to my HELOC would require an exception that BofA can not accommodate. This would have been helpful information to know prior to closing and paying nearly {$50000.00} of closing and refinancing costs. I find it unconscionable that after working with Bank of America in good faith and incurring massive costs that I now find myself forced to seek out an alternative HELOC AFTER Bank of America effectively locked me into a mortgage refinancing at a significant UPFRONT cost to me. I was clearly mislead. My refinancing business was sought after by several competing institutions but I decided to stay with BofA given the long relationship. 

Again, my HELOC request was raised during the 1st mortgage home refinancing process and I was told we will handle it after the mortgage is closed. At no time was I made aware there may be the need for exceptions.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Received a notice from Synchrony Bank in XXXX XXXX about an unpaid balance of {$280.00} that I never charged to my XXXX  gas card account. 
They stated the account was past due over 6 months and have sold the debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX. 
I never charged the {$280.00} to my account. Also, until I received this notification letter, I never received any communications from Synchrony Bank that there was any balance due on my account at all. Nothing. No mail, calls, etc. I've lived at the same address for the last 30 years. 
I sent them a payment of {$35.00} in XX/XX/2020 for a balance due I owed of {$35.00} so I was paid up in full. I never used my XXXX  card again since then. 
I called their customer service number and was told my account was closed and sold off. 
They finally gave me a PO box address to send a complaint letter too. I have notified XXXX of a fraud alert and made an official report with my local sheriff 's dept. 
I am sending letters to both Synchrony Bank and XXXX XXXX XXXX of the situation and the obvious fraud. I had a perfect credit rating before this happened.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XX/XX/2020 we contacted Sun Trust now Truist that we would like to terminate our private mortgage insurance under the Home Owners Protection Act. We received a letter from SunTrust that our request had been denied because we did not meet the requirements because our payment history did not qualify, stating that we had a payment that was 60 days or more past due within the first 12 months of the last 2 years prior to the cancellation date. I replied back to the letter via email and explained to there must be something in error because we had never been late on our mortgage payment. The only time we did not pay as scheduled was when we were given the option by the lender to participate in a forbearance program during the height of the pandemic. We were never told that if we participate in the forbearance program that was authorized and backed by the federal government that we would not be eligible to participate in the Home Owners Protection Act even though our home meets the 80 % of the original value of our property. After sending an email to the person listed on the denial letter as our home owner client representative asking for an explanation, there has been no reply or calls from SunTrust now Truist.

I also tried the search function with " credit card year end summary '' and then just plain " year end summary and it didn't show up. Once on the page, I found out it isn't just a page to get the summary, but to ENROLL in a REQUEST to get one AND the request has to be made by XXXX XXXX of the prior year. When I asked about this I was told ( paraphrased ) " nothing we can do ''.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/2020 I have received two transaction from my client in XXXX, XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$470.00} and {$320.00} ( attached ). However the sending XXXX XXXX routed the transactions through its affiliate Wells Fargo while disguising the international origin of the wire transactions ( violation of the Patriot Act II ) .. What was received on the end was {$50.00} less for both transactions as the XXXX XXXX XXXX disguised any fees charged to both my client and me and the transactions arrived as {$450.00} and {$290.00} respectively without any proper transaction routing and fee listing disclosures. What bank is doing is not only unethical but illegal and it must be stopped as this type of practice also encourages money laundering and complete lack of accountability/transparency. XXXX XXXX and Wells Fargo refused to answer any questions regarding this transaction.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I have had a business checking account with Bank of America since XXXX. I applied for and received a first round of PPP through them. That was a horrible, fraught process filled with dysfunction. I approached them again beginning on XX/XX/XXXX to begin to apply for the second round of PPP, the deadline for which is XX/XX/XXXX. Despite repeated ongoing attempts over hours, days, multiple departments, escalations, local business representatives, " tech support, '' etc., the dysfunction is so complete that not a single person has been able to correct the problem. I successfully submitted the application and additional documents were requested ( six bank statements from my BOA account showing the disparity in 3Q income between XXXX and XXXX ). I am unable to upload these documents to complete the application. There is a problem with the login credentials I was given by BOA and there is no way for me to upload the documents into any kind of portal. My loan application is not associated with the credentials or login I have been given. Wherever it is, I am locked out of it and can not access it.No one has been able to fix this issue. No one cares. I need this fixed today to complete my PPP application. I have no where else to turn. I have kept a log of most of my interactions but at this point they are so extensive and horrific I am not going to waste further time enumerating them here. A few images them are attached.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: This is more of a general complaint because it has happened numerous times with different institutions, but I'm writing because it just happened to my family again last week. I took our dog to the vet 's office and when they ran my debit card for payment they accidentally charged {$1100.00} instead of {$120.00}. They realized the mistake immediately after it happened and refunded {$1000.00} to my debit card. The issue I have is that money can be deducted from our checking accounts instantly but for money to go back in can take up to a full week. For that week, our account can be depleted or overdrawn, and nobody is technically liable for fees incurred except us as the user, not to mention not having that money available for other bills like groceries. The bank in this instance is Bank of America, but this has happened with other banks as well.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: I paid off my car loan with Ally Auto on XX/XX/2020. On XX/XX/2020 I received an email stating that the title was released and I should see it in 7 days. I called in XXXX to ask where it was. I was then told that they did not have it that the DMV in CT had it. I then emailed the DMV and was told that they did not in fact have it, that the lean holder has the title. I then called Ally back and was first told that the DMV has it until I told them that I already talked to the DMV. Then they changed their story and said it was already mailed out. I then asked for the tracking information and was told that they miss placed it. They then went on to tell me I had to pay for a duplicate tile and when I refused to do so they ordered one for me. I then received an email on XX/XX/2020 stating it was just sent out to a 3rd party. So I gave it time to get here and it never showed up. I just called them back today and was told it must have been sent to the wrong address and that they would order another duplicate title. My car is now unregistered and I can not drive the car that I paid off in XXXX.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: I pay SallieMae monthly for a personal loan through my banks bill pay on time. I do not wish to have the company automatically deducted from my account for personal reasons. My bank deducts and sends them the money. About 3 months ago SallieMae started calling me everyday until the payment was received and telling me they did not receive the payment. I called my bank and disclosed the payment was never received and the bank conferenced called SallieMae to get them to waive any outstanding late fees. My bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX  said this company does not have an electronic agreement with Salliemae. They send a check to SallieMae. The problem lies in the fact that they would call me several times a day for several days even after the conference call with the bank and annoy me regarding my payment. This has gone on for several months after telling them I spoke to someone about this. I have finally blocked as many of their numbers as I can. They have now resorted to sending emails. I have finally learned that they have several addresses to which one can get a check to them faster. I find this whole experience incredible since all of their transactions are paperless, and yet they do not have some type of electronic transfer for payment with a major bank. I almost believe this is deliberate so they can tack on more interest and late fees.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Several times my husband and I have asked this company add me to the account so things can be discussed with myself as they left me off original paperwork. Last year we had issues with the servicing company paying the wrong property taxes from our escrow account. ( XXXX ) After many emails, calls, and faxes later they finally paid them late. 2 weeks of fighting & proving the correct plat # due to their clerical error. 
All the while we were being told our property could go up for auction. I only figured this out when applying for homestead exemption. 
Then our payments went up as I'm sure they passed along the late payment to us due to their mistake. 
This year they say they sent payment for homeowners insurance XX/XX/XXXX. ( It was due XX/XX/XXXX ) As of XX/XX/XXXX payment has not been received. As the rep told my husband last night " unfortunetely '' we have no choice in who services our loan. 
These people don't care as it's not them who's being affected. 
XXXX XXXX is used by Lake View. Find a company who's going to service loans correctly.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX   website showed payment successful, did not let us fix typo, then 7 days later charged erroneous {$25.00} fee. Loan Care refuses to communicate. 

On XX/XX/2021, we used the loancare.com website to pay my mortgage payment of XXXX due XX/XX/2021. We made and immediately recognized a typographical error in the bank account number for the ACH transfer. Loan Care 's low-quality, XXXX  website did not give me the option to correct the typographical error in the account number. My co-borrower and I tried twice to contact Loan Care to fix the account number, but Loan Care refuses to respond to our attempts to contact them. 

Up until today, XX/XX/2021, the loancare.com website showed in the payment history that the XX/XX/2021 payment had been made successfully. It showed " XX/XX/2021 '' for the next payment due, and would not allow us to make the XX/XX/2021 payment again with the right bank account number. 

Today, the payment history on the loancare.com website changed and showed " BadCheckReversal, '' but did allow us to make the payment for XXXX again with the right bank account number. To our surprise, when we went to pay the {$3400.00} payment for XXXX today, the website forced an additional {$25.00} " NSF '' fee on us without our consent, and forced us to pay {$3400.00} instead of the {$3400.00} we owe. Loan Care has not responded to our attempts to contact them. 

This {$25.00} NSF fee is not right. We did not agree to it. We want it reversed. We also want Loan Care to reply within a reasonable time ( i.e, within 1 business day ) when we contact them. Could the CFPB please help? Thanks! XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: I spoke with the company regarding ticket debt after the county the tickets were owed to forwarded me to them only to find out this debt was in place for over 2 years I was never contacted by mail or phone or given the chance to dispute after calling and confirming my address I still received no letter and was told they will be adding collection agency fees to the debt

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I contracted with XXXX for pest control services. XXXX used the wrong product and did not control my problem. They made a 2nd attempt but failed. I cancelled their service ( within 30 days of payment ) and notified them both by telephone and in an email that I was cancelling their service and requested a refund. They did not respond within 2 weeks so I filed a complaint with the credit card company that I used to pay them. The credit card company gave me a " conditional credit '' pending resolution. The credit card company allows 60 days for the billing company to respond but they did not do so within the time allotted. Therefore, the credit card company made my conditional credit a permanent credit. Months later, Nationwide Credit issued me a notice of attempt to collect a debt on behalf of XXXX. XXXX never replied to my credit card company and now they are harassing me through Nationwide Credit to ILLEGALLY attempt to collect a debt that is beyond the statute of limitations. 

Please issue a " cease and desist '' notice to both XXXX and Nationwide Credit. 
Thank you.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been unsuccessfully trying to contact a human person at thiscompany for over two weeks. I have also put numerous requests thru the online system which also went unanswered. My concern is with my mortgage payment and I need verification that we will not be charged any fees for late payments. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed check number # XXXX to the company. This was for the Escrow shortage of the year. The check was for {$330.00}. As of today, this check has still not been cashed or processed. Secondly, on XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed in our monthly mortgage payment in the amount of {$2400.00}. This was check number # XXXX. 

After trying to get thru to this company and not being able to, I placed a stop payment on the check # XXXX and paid a {$30.00} fee with my bank to get this accomplished. I then completed a onetime payment on the website of {$2500.00} on XX/XX/XXXX so that our monthly payment would be covered, and we would not get a late fee. 

I then got notification that the check # XXXX has cashed! You can imagine my annoyance when this cleared. This check was returned, and I was charged a fee. 

At this time, the check for the shortage of {$330.00} has also been returned and we have a late fee on the account.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: While deployed with the United States XXXX I received late charges to my Macy 's credit card account. Prior to deployment I requested to temporarily delay payments due to the inability to reliably submit payments while serving in a remote location. My account was sent to the Macy 's collection department and reported negatively on my credit report with all three bureaus. Once off deployment, I immediately contacted the collection agency, explained in detail my situation and asked for relief under the Servicemember Civil Relief Act of 2003 ( SCRA ). The collection agent and I agreed that I would pay the full amount ( {$74.00} ) and in turn, they agency would report the account as closed and delete. I fulfilled my portion of the agreement and paid the full amount of {$74.00} in XX/XX/XXXX. However, the agency did not do what was agreed and the amount was reported as a " charge-off ''. In response, I contacted the company through credit bureaus to have the account removed under the SCRA with no success.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am a victim of identity theft. Due to the Corona Virus Pandemic, we are all facing which has me sitting still at home and I saw the recent news about the multiple XXXX Data breaches. I decided to look at my credit reports from the 3 major credit bureaus and found that someone had used my Identity. I have no idea how the theft took place. I also have no knowledge of any suspects. I did not receive any money, goods, or services as a result of identity theft. I contacted the Credit Bureau and told me to file an Identity Theft Report which I am doing. I appreciate your effort in getting this matter resolved. Thank you. Please let me know if you need any other information from me to block this information from my credit report. Thank you.

Both XXXX and XXXX  have initiated a general dispute ( 30 days ) instead of the guidelines set forth by the FTC through the Fair credit reporting act section 605B which requests the reporting agencies to delete the Fraudulent accounts from my credit profiles within 4 days. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I sent {$600.00} to my brother through bank of Americas XXXX transfer service to his phone number that is linked to his XXXX XXXX account. The money was placed on hold by Bank of America for around a day. It then said that the transfer was completed. However, he never received the money. He also never received a text or email asking him to accept the transfer. He checked in both his bank app and his XXXX  app to ensure the phone number and account were correct and there was no evidence of any transfer request. I tried sending him a smaller amount to the same number and it completed with no problem. I initiated a dispute through Bank of America after waiting a week at their advice. They said they would look into it. The dispute never showed up in my open disputes menu, so I had to call them every time I wanted to check its status which I did around three times. Eventually I got a letter saying that the dispute was rejected but that they had contacted his bank to continue the investigation on their end. He then called his bank and they said they have not been contacted by Bank of America regarding this matter. They dont have any record of the transfer or the money in relation to his account.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative: A debt collector with a return address of XXXX, KS has been sending collection notices regarding a judgement in some court in Kansas regarding a debt owed to a bank in Oklahoma. I have twice requested certified court documents to verify this judgement that the collector claims has been rendered in favor of the bank in Oklahoma. This collection agency ( initially named H. Kent Hollins and now is going by the name Hollins & McVay , P.A . ) since being located in Kansas and attempting to collect a debt from a Texas resident, myself, is required by Texas law to be registered and bonded through the Texas Secretary of State, which they are not. This has been brought to the attention of the debt collector and they continue to send collection notices.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted CFPB on XX/XX/XXXX to report that inXX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America ( BOA ) denied my request for an increase in my credit limit on my Bank of America credit card. At that time, it cited as its decision : *Utilization of your credit is too high *Current or past delinquency with one or more of your creditors *Too many consumer finance company accounts For more than a year, I have been renovating my home, so my credit utilization that BOA felt is too high is reflective of those renovations. My credit is current and well-managed. I disagree with BOA 's assessment of my credit utilization, but there appears to be little that I can do about this issue. However, I adamantly object to the remaining two reasons that BOA cited -- delinquencies and finance companies on my credit report. 

There were no delinquencies or finance companies listed on my credit report when I requested the credit increase in XXXX of XXXX. Therefore, when I submitted my complaint to CFPB in XXXX of XXXX, I specifically requested that BOA state exactly what delinquencies and finance companies it identified. 

In late XXXX of XXXX, I received a written response from a BOA representative named XXXX XXXX. Mr. XXXX regurgitated exactly what was stated in the original letter of denial that was sent to me in XXXX of XXXX. Mr. XXXX failed to satisfy my request to specifically state exactly what delinquencies and finance companies it identified. 

I faithfully review my credit file at the start of each year because I do not like surprises. I know exactly what is on my credit report. All errors or items of concern that I find are immediately reported for correction, which is why I am requesting that BOA/Mr. XXXX clearly identify by name the items that it cited as the reason for its decision. BOA is either deliberately misrepresenting the information it alleges is in my credit report or it is reviewing inaccurate information -- information that is not on the reports that I review every single year. I am attempting to get to the bottom of a problem that BOA alleges exists. Since it is making statements that I know are inaccurate, it must clarify those statements. 

I am again requesting that BOA provide me with the requested information. I will not consider this complaint closed until BOA has responded to my satisfaction. 

The CFPB reference number for my XXXX to CFPB is XXXX.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative: I was THD/CBNA customer since 2018 and during that time, I have enjoyed my experience greatly. I am writing to see if you would be willing to make a " goodwill '' adjustment to your reporting to the three credit agencies. I have late payments on the above referenced account due to COVID-19 pandemic. Since that time I was an exceptional customer paying every month on time. Because of my exceptional payment history over the last years, I would like you to consider removing the negative payment from my credit report. At the time of the late payments, I was in the process of changing jobs. I say that not to justify why the payments were late, but rather to show that the late payments are not a good indicator of my actual credit worthiness.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In the month of XXXX we mailed our mortgage payment but it was not shown as received, due to postal delays. We were advised to place a stop payment and make phone payment. We notified them of the stop payment and made a phone payment. 
They applied the phone payment and also attempted to cash the stopped payment. 
We requested a return of the overpayment. They removed this payment from our mortgage record but did not reimburse us. 
Our bank did not process the attempted cashing of the stopped payment. 
We waited for the reimbursement but eventually made a second phone payment to protect our credit rating. 
We have been in contact with SunTrust ( Truist ) bank since the middle of XXXX. We have been reassured on multiple occasions that the overpayment was being made to our bank, and later that it was being applied to our XXXX mortgage payment. 
The executive services department of the bank has begun as escalated case review as of the beginning of this week. 
Despite this we received in the mail today a notification of no XXXX payment receipt and that a late fee for XXXX was being applied.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX $ withdrawal from a non Wells Fargo ATM in XXXX XXXX Ca on XX/XX/2021. Posted to my account on XX/XX/2021. I contacted Wells Fargo on the early morning of XX/XX/2021 to report the fraudulent withdrawal. Wells Fargo waited till XX/XX/2021 to do any investigation about the the withdrawal. On XX/XX/2021 during that phone call they determined the withdrawal wasn't fraudulent because there was no inaccurate pin punched in and the chip was read. The bank has stated during several subsequent calls to the claims department that there is no way to replicate a chip on an ATM card. Today XX/XX/2021 I was transferred to the Wells Fargo executive office and spoke with an XXXX XXXX. XXXX told me he couldn't do anything to help me because the claims department told him the claim would not be reopened for further investigation. XXXX hung up on me. 
I am filing a complaint because I was not in XXXX XXXX and neither was my card. Fraud has been committed by someone, somehow and Wells Fargo has no concern for the safety of my account or my money. I am essentially being called a liar. 
I have made several attempts to rectify this incident with Wells Fargo. After my phone call today where XXXX stated he was sorry for " all of this '', I am feeling traumatized and victimized by the person who took my money and by Wells Fargo for further victimizing me by not believing me. 
I am willing to submit any documentation that I have. I am also willing to testify against them sworn in under oath. I am extremely offended by their accusation that I am going through all of this headache to take XXXX $ from them. 
I feel that Wells Fargo has acted against my best interests as their costumer and for your agency to please investigate them in this matter. 
I have attached two transaction that I physically used my card and the fraudulent ATM withdrawal.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: 2 payments of {$300.00} were taken out of my account on XX/XX/XXXX. I only authorized 1 payment of {$300.00} for my XXXX car payment with Ally. I called and was told it was a mistake and I would be refunded one of the payments and the other would be applied to my account. After 45 days, I received a notice that my account was past due. Each time I call, I am told that is because I was refunded for my XXXX payment so that my account was no longer in good standing since I missed a payment. I have to explain each time I call my situation and that I was double charged. Each time I call, I am told I missed a different payment ( sometimes I am told XXXX and other times the representative guesses a different month ). Finally, I faxed and emailed my bank statements on XX/XX/XXXX to show the double payment and then only 1 refund. I called and was told they were never received and that I sent them to wrong fax number. That happened multiple times. Finally, it was confirmed that my fax was received on XX/XX/XXXX and that it would take 24-48 hours to review. I called after 48 hours and was told it typically takes 3-4 business days and someone will contact me. No one ever called me. I called in again and was told it was being worked on and to call back in 2 days. I did this multiple times. I finally spoke to a woman that let me know that my extra payment was probably applied to my principal and it would need transferred to my balance due and she transferred me to another person. This never happened. Today, on XX/XX/XXXX, I called in to ask for an update and no one had heard of my case. I had to re explain what happened and the representative told me he filed a claim to investigate. This is now 16 business days after Ally has received my bank statements by fax. I can not keep explaining my situation, as this company is not diligently working on getting this resolved.

I have accounts with several banks and credit unions. All banks and credit unions provided my tax documents electronically ( usually a downloadable document from their website ). This is true for various tax documents ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, etc. ). The Navy Federal Credit Union, however, does not provide an electronic copy on their website. 

I called to ask for the electronic copy, but the customer service manager responded that the Navy Federal Credit Union only sends paper versions by mail. I explained that every other financial institution provided electronic copies, which should be standard after the pandemic started 10 months ago. The Navy Federal Credit Union refused. 

I explained that every other business has adopted to operating during the pandemic by providing documents electronically and that I would need the electronic copy to respond to requests by the IRS by email. This is quite frustrating and antiquated. 

Does the CFPB provide guidance to financial institutions for providing electronic copies of documents, especially during the pandemic? Thanks very much.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: We took out a HELOC on our former home in XXXX  with XXXX XXXX in XXXX. Property was sold in XXXX and loan was paid off and closed. We started receiving monthly statements from Bank of America ( who acquired XXXX in XXXX XXXX in XXXX about HELOC advances. We had recently taken out a HELOC on our new property in XXXX ( BOA was servicing agent for XXXX ), and I made the payments as requested ( I did not check account numbers -family medical issues, husband travelling back and forth to XXXX for work - I didn't pay attention ). We were pursuing a refinance/reverse mortgage and credit report showed 2 obligations ( HELOC ). I went back through records and found the paperwork ( from XXXX ) with payoff, acknowledgement that the account would be closed and no further advances made, copy of payoff letter and check. I contacted BOA in XX/XX/XXXX ; customer service insisted the loan was never closed and we owed the money. When I said we had sold the property, the representative said it would now be listed as an unsecured loan. I requested transaction history, as well as documentation showing that we authorized the loan to be reopened, and provided copies of the payoff documents. The transaction history showed advances during a couple of months in XXXX. I pulled deposit history for all of our accounts for that period and none of the deposits matched the dates or amounts in the transaction history. I contacted BOA on numerous occasions, both in writing and by telephone, and always got the same answer. In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX, a BOA senior mortgage analyst, who said the Bank 's records did not go back that far and they had nothing to show that the loan was closed. In XXXX, I was contacted by someone in their Mortgage Fraud Department who identified herself as " XXXX '' and said she was contacting me to try and resolve our claim. I returned the call and her voicemail message was " she was out of the office and unable to take the call. This went on for weeks and, in XX/XX/XXXX, we were able to talk to each other and she indicated that she wanted to '' start '' our claim and requested documentation. She also indicated that her investigator would be contacting us. No one ever contacted us. I tried calling again and got the same voicemail message. The investigator 's phone number ( given to me by XXXX ) was a non-existent number at BOA. My last correspondence with XXXX was XX/XX/XXXX and my last telephone attempt was XX/XX/XXXX. This loan was closed in XXXX. We never authorized it to be reopened, and the payments ( in excess of {$13000.00} ) were made by me in error. The bank has had the benefit of my mistake in payments since XXXX, and now they are purposely " kicking the can down the road '' and not addressing the situation.
